Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: From a certified biodynamic vineyard, this white offers mouthcoating flavors of apple, peach and grapefruit brightened by sappy acidity. The vivid freshness and exceptional length of this wine make it a good match for poultry, pork, pasta salads and seafood.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: North Coast, North Coast, California, US
Description: This nicely dry and tangy, medium-bodied wine offers fresh apricot and green-apple aromas, vivid fruit flavors and nuances of almond that build on the palate. It is a flavorful, complex and balanced white.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Anthony & Dominic 2018 Reserve Ryan German Vineyards Pinot Gris (North Coast)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A light pinkish tint lets some of the grape variety's natural color come through in this excellent, lively peach-and-apricot scented wine. A sense of freshness and crispness helps the flavors really pop.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Parducci 2020 Small Lot Pinot Gris (Mendocino County)

Description: An apricot aroma and a strong buttery flavor give this wine a lot of personality. The butterscotch and ripe fruit notes are coated in a rich, mouthfilling texture despite low alcohol.                      Jim Gordon
Name: 101 North NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Very aromatic and bright, this charming wine overflows with aromas of lemon blossoms and crisp apples, offers fresh citrus flavors and great balance. It's refreshing and vibrant.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Navarro 2019 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fresh aromas of Anjou pear flesh, gardenia and peach blossoms make for a very floral and inviting nose on this bottle from a vineyard that overlooks the ocean. There's ample grip to the sip, where lime-like bubblegum flavors make for a lively, refreshing experience.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Derby 2018 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: This is a new offering from the winery, with the grapes left on skins for 40 days. The color is almost apple cider-like in appearance but with a slightly more red, cloudy hue. The aromas bring notes of fresh raspberry, pink grapefruit and whole pomegranate. The flavors are bright and fresh, with a lot of texture and graininess in feel. The aesthetics of the color might dissuade some, but the aromas and flavors deliver.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Skin Contract De Gris Underwood Mountain Vineyards
Name: Savage Grace 2019 Skin Contract De Gris Underwood Mountain Vineyards Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Light but distinctive, this elegant wine carries floral, pine and a hint of pineapple in its basket of flavors, braced nicely by brisk acidity that balances good concentration and depth. It shows what a cool climate can do for an often boring varietal.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Handley 2019 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of star fruit and Asian pear, with whiffs of the underside of a pineapple and the palate showing more of the same. A mouthwatering finish caps it off. It's a distinctive wine for the state. I can't think of another quite like it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Boomtown 2019 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A light buttery, nutty quality gives this wine a serious, mature edge that is fascinating to taste. Almond, vanilla and a hint of honey dominate very dry fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bee Hunter 2017 Filligreen Farms Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Edna Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of honeysuckle, grapefruit and pear peel on the clean nose. The palate is a bit subtle in texture, but delivers fine flavors of tart pear and apple skin.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tangent 2019 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The handwritten label indicates that this is a limited edition wine, sourced from the original vines, now a half century old. This is done in a subtle, elegant style that rewards your full attention. Hints of bee pollen, lemon rind and brioche adorn a deceptively light but textured and layered wine with a lingering finish. The green apple fruit anchors the palate without dominating.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2019 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Eyrie was the first to plant Pinot Gris in America, long before it became Oregon's most famous white grape. No surprise that five decades later it's Eyrie that makes the state's most distinctive, elegant version of the grape. Beautifully textured mixed tree fruits—apple and white peach—are on display here, along with details of freshly baked bread and light herbs such as parsley. A touch of melon comes up in the back palate, and the wine just keeps chugging along through a marvelous finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Eyrie Vineyards 2018 Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A chunky, fruity, tangy style, this delicious bottle pulls tangerine, pear and apple fruit flavors into the center ring. It's spicy, juicy and just plain yummy. As in past vintages, the intensity is further amped up by perfectly pitched acidity, thanks to no malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cardwell Hill 2019 Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean and snappy aromas of crystallized citrus and pome fruits are sharp but forgiving on the nose of this barrel-fermented bottling, which also offers a hint of honey dust. The palate shows green-pear and tight apricot flavors, wrapped in a grippy texture and washed by refreshing acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bargetto 2019 Regan Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in a mix of French oak barrels and stainless steel, this rich, textural take on Pinot Gris boasts multiple layers. Plenty of ripe pear fruit anchors the palate, laced with touches of baking spice, vanilla cream and toasted walnuts. A most pleasurable wine for enjoying over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2018 Reserve Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Hints of smoke and cashew accent zippy lemon, apple and grapefruit flavors in this dry, medium-bodied white. Fresh-fruited yet anchored by a firm mineral undertone, it's a vibrant, juicy wine that's substantial enough to drink well through 2024.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2018 Kabinett Dry Pinot Gris (Baden)

Description: Pinot Gris (aka Pinot Grigio) is a pink-hued grape and this pretty, coppery-pink wine tiptoes the line between a white and rosé wine. Macerated on its skins for 12–18 hours, it offers concentrated raspberry and red apple flavors against a backdrop of citrusy acidity and a clean mineral tang. Dry and delightfully refreshing, it's a fantastic year-round accompaniment to everything from fish to game.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2018 Becker Family Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This medium-bodied white starts off with zesty aromas of crushed stone, lime peel and white blossoms. There's rounded, juicy weight on the palate, yet still a tautness to the yellow plum and pear fruit that comes off slightly waxy. Bright acidity shines through, with a gentle creaminess lingering on the close.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lenz 2015 Estate Selection Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

Description: Well-defined flavors feature green melon, lime and apple, with a sharp hint of gooseberry. It's a fresh, minerally style, relatively low in alcohol but nicely balanced. It did not go through malolactic, so it's a style that favors acid lovers.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: From young vines planted in 2016, this wine is a triumph. Bright, zesty aromas of yellow apple, Meyer lemon and honeysuckle are concentrated and lifted on the nose. There's a gentle roundness to the light-bodied palate, with juicy, plush apple and lemon flavors that don't falter from start to finish. A bit of pithy waxiness lends some grip to an otherwise delightfully fruity wine.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Bedell 2019 Pinot Gris (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Santa Maria Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Slightly honeyed aromas kick off the nose of this bottling, which also shows orange blossom, struck stone, baked apple and a hint of wax. The palate tangs with grapefruit peel before leading into roasted apple and an array of floral flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lumen 2019 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Lemon and lime peel aromas meld with depths of honeysuckle and honeycomb wax on the nose. There's a pleasing silkiness to the medium-bodied palate, with ample acidity lending lift. A gentle waxy lemon-rind note lingers on the close of this textural white.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Red Newt Cellars 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: This fruit-powered, gulpable wine is loaded with a pear flavor. The midpalate fills out further with yellow apple fruit, and the lightly creamy finish satisfies. It's a fine everyday white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: A to Z 2019 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: Grapefruit, pear and pineapple notes gain power from nose to finish in this fresh, fruity white. Dry and medium-bodied in style, it's a thirst-quenching, delicately saline sip with an easy yet elegant appeal. Best now–2023.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2019 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This skin-contact wine made from biodynamic grapes is iconoclastic and worth trying. A fascinating luminescent copper color and a scent like kombucha lead to vibrant mandarin orange, earth and almond flavors on a technically light body supported by tangy acidity. It looks and tastes like a rosé but the winery doesn't call it that.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Donkey & Goat 2019 Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Ripe yellow plum, apple, honeysuckle and honeycomb wax aromas carry to the billowy, textured palate. There's a gentle waxiness to the fruit flavors on the rich, medium-bodied palate, with just enough acidity for lift. It ends with some floral bitters.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Living Roots 2018 Golden Bosc Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Apple, pear and lemon peel aromas are zesty and brisk on the nose. There's a pleasing roundness to the palate, with plenty of taut acidity and juicy orchard fruit flavors to lift it up.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2019 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is done in an easy-going, lightly fruity style, with an appealing flinty character. Fermented entirely in stainless, its slightly granular pear fruit is laced with lemon. The finish leaves a lingering hint of spice.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Territorial 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of fresh apple and honeysuckle carry the delicate nose. There's a gentle roundness to the medium-bodied palate, with juicy orchard fruit flavors wrapped in a bit of dry honeycomb and white flowers.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2018 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Description: Nectarine, lime-pith, lemon-blossom and pink-fleshed-fruit aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which exhibits the slightest shade of pink in the glass. Yellow-apple-skin flavors pop on the soft palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Estancia 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of juiced apple and pear meld with a bit of warm spice tones in this Pinot Gris that's partially aged in neutral French oak. Firmly medium in weight, there's roundness to the juicy orchard fruit on the palate, with a gentle wrapping of warm spice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Hector Wine Company 2018 Pinot Gris (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sourced from the Dion Vineyard, this refreshing, lightly sweet bubbly is much like a Prosecco, done with the pear fruit flavors of this iconic Oregon grape. Hints of honey that streak through the nose and the palate, along with the fruit sweetness that rounds off the acidity, make this exceptionally versatile as an aperitif, a mimosa mixer or even poured after dinner with a chunk of blue cheese.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Abbey Road Farm 2019 Sparkling Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a distinct white button mushroom aroma to this wine, which adds a pleasing earthiness to the citrus and pear fruit. It's light in feel but properly lifted by refreshing acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Lakewood 2018 Gigliotti Vineyards Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: North Fork of Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: This bright, fruity wine is driven by banana, pineapple, pear and apple on the nose. There's a gentle creaminess to the palate, where the orchard fruit flavors are demure and are lifted by a mild vein on acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Designation: Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard
Name: Bedell 2019 Small Batch Series Corey Creek Vineyard Pinot Grigio (North Fork of Long Island)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite its youth, this is a mellow, simple wine, with pleasantly generic varietal flavors touching on pear fruit. The buttery finish suggests that some or all may have gone through malolactic fermentation. Drink this over the next year or two, chilled a bit to bring more focus.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Great Oregon Wine Company 2019 La Chouette Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Brisk aromas of lemon-lime popsicle and red apple carry to the medium-bodied palate. There's tautness to the acidity and texture, holding all that juicy fruit in check, but it ends rather quickly.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Atwater 2018 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: There's a slightly candied vibe to the brisk aromas of apple, pear and lemon on the nose. It's light in feel on the palate, with brisk orchard fruit flavors that end a bit short.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2019 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of juiced pear and a hint of warm spice lead to the juicy palate. The flavors are a bit muted, but what's there is nice.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Penguin Bay 2019 Pinot Grigio (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Aromas of candied lemon and lime peels meld with a bit of savory yeast on the nose. It starts off creamy on the light-bodied palate, lifted by brisk flavors of yellow apple and citrus, with sharp acidity and more savoriness arising on the finish.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Glenora 2019 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: There's not a whole lot of fruit intensity to this white, giving just hints of citrus and apple away. Texturally, it shows some roundness that's held in check by taut acidity.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Wölffer 2019 Cellar Series Pinot Gris (Long Island)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This captivating Pinot Gris takes biodynamic grapes, lets them sit on the skins until a warm copper-rose color is obtained, then ferments and ages them in a mix of amphora, concrete egg and neutral oak. Persimmon, cooked apples and pears, sliced citrus, crushed stone and acidity come into complete harmony on the full-bodied palate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Authentique 2018 Leisure Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This succulent and lip-licking style punches up bold, almost fleshy flavors of ripe pear fruit. It's a bright and sassy wine, full bodied and buttressed with lemony acids. The freshness and length are especially noteworthy.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Chehalem 2019 Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Mellow vanilla, inflected with creamy hazelnut, fills the smooth nose. The same hit of oaky vanilla also fills the palate. The rich, rounded, creamy and velvety texture enhance these notions even more. A lovely core of bright, lemony freshness holds against this. Drink 2021–2031.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kracher 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This white is bright and snappy, with well-defined flavors of apple, pear and melon. The fruit intensity and the bright acidity and overall balance are impressive at any price.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Eola Hills 2019 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Description: This is a full-throttle orange wine from one of the country's top biodynamic producers. Pinot Gris plus a bit of Muscat and Gewürztraminer is left on skins for 40 days. The result is a marmalade-hued wine that jumps from the glass with heady notes of orange peel, cinnamon, cloves and Campari-like bitters. It's pithy and textural on the palate, with a crunch of acidity. Enjoy with gooey cheeses, mushroom risotto, pork chops or a myriad other dishes.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Pyramid Valley 2019 Orange Pinot Gris (North Canterbury)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: The elegance of wines sourced from this cool-climate AVA is much in evidence here. Refined, almost delicate but perfectly ripe apples, Asian pears and Bartlett pears are the focus. Aging in a mix of stainless steel and concrete egg adds subtle hints of stone. As it opens up in the finish, it brings in apple-pie spices.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lachini 2019 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a serious effort that displays the complexity that this grape can achieve at times in Oregon. Apple, Asian pear and Bartlett pear flavors combine, with a squirt of citrus adding some extra zip. This is a powerful, fruit-driven wine that should age gracefully over the next half decade.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Panther Creek 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a fruit-driven wine, with fleshy flavors of pear and apple. A thin lick of citrus slices through the core, and some time on the lees adds a bit of creamy texture to the finish. Enjoy through 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Sharp aromas of lime and grapefruit peel meet with warmer touches of yellow pear, shiso and makrut lime leaf on the nose of this bottling. There is plenty of texture and grip to the sip, where light yellow-plum and green-melon flavors ride a lingering acidity.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2019 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Spicy pear fruit grabs hold of the palate and hangs on all the way through. It's got a granular, slightly crunchy mouthfeel, and backing acids that bring a splash of grapefruit and lemon. It's a refreshing, solid, tart wine that should be enjoyed over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carabella 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented entirely in stainless, this fresh and vibrant wine sparks to life with a mix of pear and apple, lemon rinds and pink grapefruit. The palate-cleaning mouthfeel leaves a light and delightful impression of wet stone minerality. Enjoy this now through 2022.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Reustle 2018 Prayer Rock Vineyards Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is left on the skins long enough to turn it a reddish copper, and it has entered orange wine territory. It's soft and slightly oxidized, with strawberry and peach-fruit flavors. There are proportionate tannins, though more than is usual in most Pinot Gris.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Big Table Farm 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a solid effort with fully ripened pear and apple fruit, the hallmark of Willamette Valley Pinot Gris. It's framed with skin flavors that set up a hard stop at the midpoint. More bottle age may help to open up the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Westmount 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This affordable wine is almost effusively fruity, loaded with fleshy pear flavors and noticeable residual sugar. The sweetness rounds out the palate, and the wine has medium concentration through a fresh, clean finish. It would match nicely with a fruit sauce on a pork entrée.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Rainstorm 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is loaded with tart lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors. The sharp acidity is punctuated by skin phenolics, making this a palate-refreshing, fruit-driven wine. It shows potential as a companion to a wide variety of seafood dishes.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2019 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of apple, pear and apple skin are followed by broad feeling kiwi and pineapple flavors. It brings plenty of appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Nine Hats 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light but bring some complexity, with notes of apple, pear and the underside of pineapple. Mouthwatering citrus and pear flavors follow. Dried flower notes linger on the finish.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Bieler Family 2019 Daisy Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: Quite light in the glass, this simple but pleasant bottling offers light aromas of apple blossom, honeydew and a steel minerality. Riper apple-flesh flavors show on the palate as does a touch of light lime juice.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Summerland 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A hint of pink in the color and unusually ripe, floral flavors help this medium-bodied wine stand out. It's mouthfilling, smooth and full of peach and plums flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: The Girls in the Vineyard 2019 Pinot Grigio (Mendocino)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is 100% Pinot Gris, which has imparted a pretty pale-copper hue to the wine, and brings aromas and light suggestions of cantaloup melon and citrus. It's fresh and clean, with flavors that fall lightly across the palate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archer 2019 Estate Rosé of Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: As in past vintages, this includes a touch of residual sugar, rounding off the fruit flavors of pear and apple. It's not a big wine, but varietally true and perfectly pleasant. The trailing finish leaves a light impression of powdered sugar.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lujon 2018 Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This soft and approachable young wine has pretty fruit flavors of lemon curd and Bosc pear. Delicately balanced against gentle acids, it's a light and simple wine but perfectly suitable for salmon or light poultry.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cedar + Salmon 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: This medium-bodied wine tastes clean, fresh and mildly fruity, offering honeydew melon aromas, jicama flavors and a rather soft texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Barefoot NV Pinot Grigio (America)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Aged a year in French oak, this relatively high-octane wine is quickly moving into full maturity. Mashed apple and pear fruit is soft and showing pastrylike flavors. There's a touch of toast also. The best advice is drink up soon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Archer 2017 Reserve Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Description: Nearly neutral in flavor, this medium-bodied wine is rounded in texture and generally ripe tasting, with a good nip of acidity for balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Insomnia NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Aromas of dried meat and honeysuckle lead to light, crisp peach and melon flavors in this medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Gnarly Head 2019 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: High-toned in acidity, this light wine is a study in white flower and wet stone, with the fruit quietly nuanced in melon and apple.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Merisi 2019 Pinot Gris (Los Carneros)

Appellation: River Junction, Central Valley, California, US
Description: This light-bodied wine offers fruity aromas of honeydew melons and straightforward flavors on a light texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: McManis 2019 Estate Grown Pinot Grigio (River Junction)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Low in alcohol and light in flavor, this feels dilute from start to finish. It hints thinly at apple and pear fruit, not much else. Simple, clean and short, it should be consumed soon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Schmidt 2019 Reserve Pinot Gris (Applegate Valley)

Description: This straightforward, medium-bodied wine offers basic melon and peach flavors and a sense of sweetness on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Trinity Oaks 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Aromas of pears and peaches give way to banana flavors and a soft texture in this medium-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brownstone NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This light-bodied, innocuous wine is very neutral in flavor, giving only a hint of cucumber. It's clean and gulpable.                      Jim Gordon
Name: PaintBox NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This is an opulent yet charming Pinot Gris from one of Marlborough's most historic wineries. Medium-gold in hue, it opens with delicate aromas of spiced apple, peach, cherry blossom and honeysuckle with saline streaks underneath. There's an ease and balance to the palate: texture, acidity and flavor all working together seamlessly. This Pinot Gris would be a happy companion to a broad array of cuisine, from Southeast Asian fare to cheese platter.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Lawson's Dry Hills 2019 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This is a new, micro-label by Hawkes Bay-based winemaker Amy Farnsworth, whose philosophy is “no additives or adulterations of any kind,” including sulfur. This Pinot Gris, cloudy and amber-hued, is a fun and funky nod towards northeast Italy. There's a bit of fizz at first but it quickly dissipates and then the focus is on the heady aromatics: nectarines, grapefruit rind, salt, beeswax, butterscotch and wildflowers. In the mouth it's light and refreshing—bone dry, with a pithy bite, like chomping on a citrus seed. Don't drink this too cold, and knock the whole bottle back straight away, for it won't hold up long. That should be an easy task considering how deliciously drinkable it is.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Amoise 2019 Gris Pinot Gris (Hawke's Bay)

Description: From the Nelson region at the top of the North Island, this affordable Pinot Gris offers notes of pear and honeysuckle, backed by subtler aromas like ginger and something dustier, like the spine of a library book. Fruit on the palate is tangy although acidity isn't as lifted as other PGs. Nevertheless there's a lovely texture and food friendliness here that makes for an easy-drinking drop.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Middle-Earth 2019 Pinot Gris (Nelson)

Description: White spring-flower and white stone-fruit aromas lead the nose on this tangy white. On the refreshing palate, crisp acidity accompanies yellow apple and apricot before finishing on a lime note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Stemmari 2019 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Bright aromas of pear and cantaloupe lead to fleshy kiwi, papaya and other tropical-fruit flavors. It's a cornucopia of fruit, with a zing on the finish tying it together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Lone Birch 2019 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: This is a solid, and beautifully labeled example of a white wine variety that has seen a rise in popularity in New Zealand. While there's what feels like a fair whack of sulfur on the nose, this is nonetheless ripe and fruity, bouncing from the glass with notes of pears, peaches, nectarines, and a floral-soap character often found in this variety, akin to lavender talcum powder. The palate neatly balances bright acidity with a slippery texture. It remains fruity but is also dry and refreshing.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Astrolabe 2019 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: This wine has more flavor than many of its competitors, boasting bright peach and ripe melon in the aroma and satisfying white peach on the palate. It's medium bodied and mouthfilling.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bota Box 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: San Diego County, South Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of wet stone, lime and nectarine show on the crisp nose of this bottling. There is a strong sizzle at the front of the sip, which drops into riper flavors of pear and apple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hungry Hawk 2019 Pinot Gris (San Diego County)

Description: Lively and well-concentrated, too, this medium-bodied wine has good acidity to make it appetizing and plenty of tasty green-apple, white-peach and apricot flavors to savor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sand Point 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: As much about feel as flavor, this wine is a bit reductive out of the gate. Beyond that are medium-bodied apple favors that bring some heft on this otherwise neutral-seeming wine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Waterbrook 2019 Pinot Gris (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A rich texture makes this wine more mouthfilling and expansive than many. It boasts tasty, seemingly sweet honeydew-melon and peach flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bucket List NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This light-bodied wine could pass for a Riesling, with its not unpleasant petrol aroma and lean peach and apricot flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Mirassou Sun 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: This fruit bowl of a wine is packed with apples, peaches and melons on a smooth, soft texture that brings a sensation of sweetness on the finish.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Winemakers Selection 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light herbs and dried grass show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat flat in texture but delivers acceptable flavors of Granny Smith apples and more dried grass.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Tree Fort 2019 Pinot Grigio (Paso Robles)

Description: This light-bodied wine is refreshing and clean but almost neutral in flavor, offering faint lemon and cucumber notes.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Sterling 2018 Vintner's Collection Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Lively green-apple aromas meet heavier flavors and a thick texture in this full-bodied wine.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Terra d'Oro 2019 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This breaks new ground for Oregon's signature white grape. It's rich and leesy, fragrant and full, a bonanza of apple, pear and melon fruits. There's a lingering trail of honeysuckle, and a lush minerality that underscores the freshness. A stunning wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Antiquum Farm 2019 Daisy Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three radically different Pinot Gris from Antiquum Farm, this was cold-soaked for 72 hours prior to pressing, yielding a coppery gold wine with intense aromas of hibiscus, rose hip tea and chamomile. Flavors follow along, edging close to light tropical with a hint of papaya. The skin phenolics linger and put a tight frame around the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Antiquum Farm 2019 Aurosa Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Intensely smoky, earthen notes that extend from nose to finish hearken back to the volcanic terraces of the Kaiserstuhl where this Pinot Gris is sourced. The palate offers pristine white grapefruit and peach flavors marked by bristling acidity and a pleasant grip of tea tannins on the finish. This is lovely in its youth, but should drink well through 2026.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2019 vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very light in the glass, this crisp and clean bottling begins with aromas of soft red apple, fat white-gardenia flower buds and a light tone of nectarine. The palate is both tight and expressive, as a firm texture delivers flavors of Asian pear, grippy tangerine skin and a touch of honeysuckle.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Brevity 2019 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Old vine, estate-grown fruit is the star here, with Asian pear and a touch of white radish front and center. It's crisp through the finish, dry but not at all sour, with a finish of slightly honeyed apples.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Brooks 2019 Brooks Estate Vineyard Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This complex, nicely detailed wine opens with aromas of flower, citrus and pear, leading into a leesy, textural palate with a mix of white peach and pear. A small percentage was fermented in neutral wood, which seems to have nicely rounded out the acids.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Anne Amie 2019 Two Estates Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: One of three radically different Pinot Gris from Antiquum Farm, this was fermented on the skins for a full month, and is approaching orange wine status. A sunset hue of orange and cherry, it tastes of blood oranges, both flesh and rind. The extended maceration does tend to flatten the flavors a bit, so drink this over the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Antiquum Farm 2019 Alium Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a well-balanced, meticulous take on this variety, all stainless fermented and finished crisp and clean. Aromas and flavors favor lovage, fennel and cilantro, with crunchy pear fruit filling out the midpalate. It's a most refreshing style, unencumbered by barrel flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Durant 2019 Southview Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fermented in both steel and oak vessels, this combines steel's zest and spice with oak's smooth and slightly buttery mouthfeel. Lemon rind, grapefruit and apple flavors are featured, and a hint of baking spices adds further flavor interest.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lady Hill 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (WA), Washington Other, Washington, US
Description: The aromas bring notes of grape skin, citrus, ale and flower. Light, bright pear and kiwi flavors follow, with plentiful acidity backing it up. The mousse seems a bit light on an otherwise enjoyable wine.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Designation: Organic Pétillant Naturel Sparkling Wine Acadia Vineyard
Name: Pét Project 2019 Organic Pétillant Naturel Sparkling Wine Acadia Vineyard Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (WA))

Description: White stone-fruit and citrus-blossom aromas emerge from the glass. The lively palate offers Bartlett pear, Meyer lemon and a ginger note alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Feudo Arancio 2019 Pinot Grigio (Sicilia)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Despite the low finished alcohol, this is not a tart or acidic wine. Rather it feels almost syrupy, though it is completely dry. There are thick fruit flavors of apple and pear, and a wash of vanilla cream as it trails out. Drink now and over the next two years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kason 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is done in a straightforward, no-frills style. Crunchy pear fruit comes across clean and simple, with balancing acidity and a quick, crisp finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kudos 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light pear and grapefruit-peel aromas are clean and bright on the nose of this bottling. The palate is simple while pleasant, offering pear and tart apple flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Rabble 2019 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Pinot Gris from Burgundy is a rather rare beast, so the back label claim that this is “Burgundian-style” doesn't shed any light on the matter. Light it is however, with clean flavors of apple and pear, medium weight and a touch of skin bitterness in the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Firesteed 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: South Coast, South Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of wet earth, lanolin and mushrooms kick off the nose on this slightly reductive bottling. There are apple and pear flavors on the palate, with a lingering hint of petrol.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Granite Lion 2019 Pinot Gris (South Coast)

Description: Purity, intensity and sweetness are evident with just one whiff of this wine. Aromas carry touches of blossom, earth and candied tangerine zest. The palate confirm these impressions with its concentrated, luscious body, tingling acid and encompassing sweetness. It's exquisite now, but even decades will not wither this wine's pristine fruit ad intensity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Séléction de Grains Nobles Schlossberg Grand Cru
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Séléction de Grains Nobles Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The intense scent of ripe, yellow pear skin on this wine's nose holds juiciness, generosity and the promise of texture. You can almost smell the sunshine on this fruit The palate reins this in and presents a smooth, precise and well-proportioned body that is suffused with appetizing juiciness. There is a hint of fruit sweetness, but a whole lot of texture, too, so the just off-dry finish is a triumph of balance. The wine is rich but utterly precise and very long. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru Vorbourg
Name: René Muré 2016 Clos Saint Landelin Grand Cru Vorbourg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: On the nose of this wine, the ripeness and headiness of Williams pear notes are immediately apparent. It also offers freshness and the gorgeously open aroma of that Williams pear suffused with lime zest. On the palate the concentration is immense but elegant. Gentle sweetness is balanced by freshness and backed by ample fruit. The finish is balanced. Lovely now, this powerful but precise wine is certain to evolve further. Drink through 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2015 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: On the nose of this wine, the ripeness and headiness of Williams pear notes are immediately apparent. It also offers freshness and the gorgeously open aroma of that Williams pear suffused with lime zest. On the palate the concentration is immense but elegant. Gentle sweetness is balanced by freshness and backed by ample fruit. The finish is balanced. Lovely now, this powerful but precise wine is certain to evolve further. Drink through 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2015 Wiebelsberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Smoky stoniness initially fills the nose on this wine. With a little more air, pear fruitiness comes though while a flinty glint of reduction smoulders in the background. The palate comes with the gentlest sweetness and still needs to knit together. Ample fruit, great energy and immense concentration are all evident in one juicy sip. This is a powerhouse of a wine, coiled tightly and streamlined into a toned swoop. It will release its force in due course. Drink 2025–2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Saint Urbain Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of baked apple and bruised, ripe apple peel signal mellowness on this wine's nose. The dry, fresh palate counters this with spicy freshness reminiscent of cinnamon, sandalwood and a touch of white pepper. Concentrated, juicy and precise, it carries that earthy spice to the fore on the dry finish. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Moenchberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A heady sense of red-cheeked Mirabelle skin and ripe pear releases fruitiness on this wine's nose. The palate pulls it all together into a body of freshness and precision. Immensely concentrated, it has a mouthwatering sense of dried citrus-peel richness. The off-dry finish displays supreme balance and convinces with solidity that echoes with pepper spice. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A touch of flinty reduction still clings to this wine's aromas of juicy pear. The palate, precise and firm, then swells to contain all the vivid, ripe pear fruit. Freshness makes the mouth water. Despite the richness, this concentrated wine stays toned and firm. The finish is just off dry and balanced, ringing with richness and precision.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An earthy smudge of yeastiness still buffers pear notes on this wine's nose, but richness is signaled right away. The palate presents rounded and buffered power that holds freshness and juiciness at its core. A textural element, slightly creamy, slightly pithy, provides an ideal backdrop for this robert, balanced wine that has an almost-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Baked-pear notes on the nose of this wine are made mellower by creaminess, but there also is a heady, fresher whiff of Williams pear. These rich aromatics also feature on the smooth, rounded but fresh palate. This is sinuous and toned in terms of shape but utterly creamy and mellow in terms of fruit and texture. An appetizing off-dry combination, the wine will evolve. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Zotzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Apple and pear intensity on this wine's nose seem to beam upward in a dense shaft of scent. The bold palate puts textural concentration center stage, with a pithy core and mouthwatering freshness that are buffered by the fruit. Compelling and just off dry, the wine makes no concessions to prettiness and seems like a message from profound earth instead. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2016 Furstentum Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of ripe Williams pear are suffused with dried lemon peel on the aromatic nose of this wine. The palate comes in with a sweet, high note of honey around which the fruit coalesces, along with a bright line of lemon. Concentration and texture as well as that dried citrus-rind freshness make this wine precise, while honeyed medium-sweetness makes it mellow. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Becker 2017 Froehn Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Creaminess accompanies pear notes on this wine's mellow nose, alongside a hint of chalk. Smoothness duly reappears on the rounded palate where concentration and richness are evident. There is a real sense of depth and of untold richness to come. Lovely now, the wine will certainly evolve. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2017 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Along with subtle notes of Williams pear on this wine's nose, it also has pear-scented headiness reminiscent of eau-de-vie. The palate provides a textured, concentrated yet juicy backdrop for this panoply of pear tones. Something mouthwatering about the intensity and vein of pleasant bitterness evokes fresh walnut skins. The finish is intense and off dry. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2016 Sonnenglanz Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Blossom honey is the first impression to come though on the shy nose of this wine. With more air this is rounded out with gentle muskiness and rich notes of Mirabelle compote. The palate of this late-harvest style brims with honeyed sweetness countered by candied-lemon concentration. This wine is sweet, intense, elegant, bold and totally aromatic with its freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2017 Vendanges Tardives Frankstein Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, generous aromas of ripe pear have an extra juiciness and fruitiness that evokes baked peach. The fruit is equally intense on the supple, rounded and rich palate where they are made more precise by citrus pithiness that lends texture and verve. There is richness and depth, but all is subtly presented.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe, pristine notes of yellow pear on this wine's nose come with notions of creamy banana and vanilla. The palate carries rich, concentrated fruit, but in a precise fashion that channels the rounded ripeness into smooth generosity. A vein of freshness and smidge of sweetness give the fruit staying power and verve. Together they present an off-dry wine with immense potential and elegance. Drink by 2045.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sipp Mack 2016 Rosacker Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Juicy pear notes on this wine's open nose are nuanced and appetizing, presenting Williams pear tempered with lemon. More ripe, aromatic and juicy pear shows on the palate. The concentrated midpalate is balanced, with a fresh finish and rounded warmth.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Zinnkoepfle Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: A waft of smoke emerges first on the mellow nose of this wine, with ripe pear flavors. The palate presents rounded and smooth pear generosity, edged with freshness that accentuates the smoothness even more. This balances the ample, full-fruited body that offers gentle warmth, freshness and an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2017 Brand Crand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gingerbread richness is aligned to pleasant walnut-peel bitterness on the intriguing nose of this wine. The concentrated palate is equally complex, rounding out autumnal spice with rich, medium-sweet pear fruit. Mellow, rich and rounded, the wine comes with a sense of balance that enhances all of those glorious spice notes.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe fresh and baked pear have a creaminess on this wine's open nose. That creaminess attains pithy texture on the rounded palate that is a beautiful foil for the rich fruit, especially baked-apple notes that come to the fore. A vein of freshness and generous warmth show on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2016 Kanzlerberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a flinty whiff of reduction flashes up before cream, pear and vanilla unite into a sensuous aroma. The palate retains that creaminess and uses it as a blackdrop for the oaky vanilla spice, notions of baked pear and the insistent, concentrated fruitiness. This rounded, medium-dry wine shows a little warmth but all comes together harmoniously.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Eichberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gingerbread richness is aligned to pleasant walnut-peel bitterness on the intriguing nose of this wine. The concentrated palate is equally complex, rounding out autumnal spice with rich, medium-sweet pear fruit. Mellow, rich and rounded, the wine comes with a sense of balance that enhances all of those glorious spice notes.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2015 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tropical hints of mango juice hover above juicy pear notes on the nose of this wine. The dry palate then fills with creamy richness and concentration, displaying the mellow ripeness of apple, the pithy zest of citrus and the rounded spice of apple tart. The rich, bold flavors come together harmoniously on the fresh, expressive palate. Bottle age will only make it more delicious. Drink by 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé 2018 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This wine gives an immediate sense of richness. Vanilla, buttery richness and the sweet spice of pear crumble jump from the glass. The palate presents mellow notions of baked fruit edged with a hint of lemon, but with that same buttery vanilla and spice roundness. All is intensified by the medium-sweet style that is nutty and rich but also balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Saint-Rémy 2017 Ehrhart Brand Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Despite vigorous swirling the aromas of this wine remain closed. Fruit concentration becomes apparent on the off-dry palate that offers the impression of ripe, juicy and mellow pear. The off-dry style homes in on the ripeness and accentuates the slight alcoholic heat. This powerful, smooth wine nonetheless has lovely freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Mambourg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Hints of peach and juicy pear are subtle on this wine's shy nose. The fruit breaks through fully on the palate to present a medium-sweet rendition of canned peaches. Lovely freshness underscores the vivid juiciness of this medium-sweet wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru
Name: Bestheim 2017 Anne de K Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A crackle of herbal savoriness on this wine's juicy nose recalls bergamot leaf. The palate immediately sets a different note of rounded, juicy sweetness that envelopes rich baked peach. That bergamot flicker helps accentuate the concentration of the rich fruit. The finish is medium sweet, peachy and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pear and wet earth are the two chief aromas on this wine's nose, while a lactic element adds an unusual tone. The palate presents concentrated, ripe pear made more intense by some alcoholic heat. Hints of mellow spiced apple create a rich aftertaste on the medium-dry wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Andre Lorentz 2016 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The exuberance of ripe, yellow pear abounds on the nose of this wine. The palate echoes this with vivid pear notes that are fresh but juicily, drippingly ripe. A touch of zesty pith and a sweet finish accentuate the rounded body and concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2018 Brudertahl Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Scented, lemony freshness lifts the pear and peach notes of this wine, creating a sense of anticipation. The palate pivots towards ripe, juicy yellow peach and revels in flavors made all the more intense by the medium-sweet style. This wine is juicy, bold and rounded.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hubert Meyer 2018 Winzenberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The mellow ripeness of russet pear is subtle on this wine's nose. Real mellowness begins to show on the palate, coming across as ripe pear surrounded by smooth hints of banana against a backdrop of creaminess. A fine line of freshness lends contour to this concentrated, rounded wine that has a nearly dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2018 Steinert Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim

Description: Ripe russet pear immediately becomes apparent on the nose of this wine, tempered by a concentrated, zesty note. Smooth, ripe pear notes are enhanced by the medium-dry style while that russet-pear-peel texture lends structure. Hints of baking spice, nutmeg and vanilla appear, making this rich and rounded wine mellow but fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2015 Gloeckelberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The exuberance of ripe, yellow pear abounds on the nose of this wine. The palate echoes this with vivid pear notes that are fresh but juicily, drippingly ripe. A touch of zesty pith and a sweet finish accentuate the rounded body and concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2018 Brudertahl Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Rich baked pear is rounded out with mellow baked apple on the expressive nose of this wine. The palate flows with medium sweetness, accentuated by gentle freshness and ripe, concentrated fruit. This wine is full-on but has a fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2017 Marckrain Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Creamy pear and the mellow ripeness of this wine's nose carry onto the juicy palate. Freshness and a citrus overtone temper the ripe pear fruit that is boosted by the medium-sweet style. This wine is full-fruited and generous.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar 2019 Hengst Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)
Winery: Domaine Viticole de la Ville de Colmar

Description: Creamy and viscous in stone fruit, mango and fig, this white is opulent in texture with a subdued, balanced sense of ripeness. The acidity is equally poised and integrated, providing lasting freshness to the fruit.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Etude 2019 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Carneros)

Description: Nicely concentrated, crisp fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a lot to like. Tangy white-peach and Pippin apple flavors are lightly accented by lemon, adding to the vibrant mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Dark Horse 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: The aromas are light, with notes of freshly cut yellow apple and pear followed by sleek, pleasing, fruit forward flavors that bring a bright sense of acidity. Acid and freshness are the drivers. Pair it with scallop ceviche with generous amounts of lime.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Cavatappi 2019 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Central Coast, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Aromas of guava and honeydew carry the fresh nose of this widely available bottling. There is a pleasing grip to the sip, where guava peel, Asian pear and cherimoya flavors meet with a hint of wet stone.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: SeaGlass 2019 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A chunky palate mixes fresh apples, a touch of Bartlett pear and the refreshing suggestion of just-sliced cucumber. It's textured and clean, underscored with a wash of wet stone.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Foris 2019 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: San Benito, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Tangy aromas of orange and lime rind meet with warm hints of freshly cut pear on the likable nose of this bottling. The palate is rounded with honeydew and white-melon flavors, made more complex by wet rock elements. It is incredibly easy to drink.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Swanson 2019 Pinot Grigio (San Benito)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Crisp and clean lines of lime, chalk and peach start the nose on this bottling. The palate is fresh, with a pleasant texture, offering light stone-fruit flavors and a hint of salt.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hahn 2019 Pinot Gris (Monterey County)

Appellation: Santa Lucia Highlands, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The slightest shade of pink in the glass, this bottling offers a simple yet pleasant nose of wet cement, white flower and nectarine aromas. Tangerine-peel and stone-fruit flavors show on the easy-to-enjoy palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Hahn 2019 SLH Pinot Gris (Santa Lucia Highlands)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This medium-bodied wine offers charming floral and peach aromas, nicely ripe flavors and a rounded mouthfeel. It's rather soft and easy to sip.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Handley 2018 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: This well-balanced and nicely fruity wine offers honeydew-melon flavors, lively acidity and a very fresh, palate-cleansing texture—a versatile wine for all seasons.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2019 Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This unusual wine appears as a light-copper-colored rosé, showing the true color of the Pinot Gris grape skins. It's full of prosciutto and melon flavors, has a rather full body and a hint of tangy acidity for good balance.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Longevity 2019 Vintner Select Pinot Grigio (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Fair Play, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Quite rich and concentrated, this ripe and peachy-tasting wine offers a mouthfilling full body and ample fruit flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Oakstone 2019 Lemley Ranch Pinot Grigio (Fair Play)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of grapefruit and nectarine make for a fresh entry on the nose of this wine. There is a compelling texture to the sip, where crushed white-rock and fresh lemon-peel flavors work just fine.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Old Creek Ranch 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Description: This is a straightforward, crisp and clean wine with good acidity and mild fruit flavors. It's light bodied and refreshing, good for everyday occasions.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Bogle 2018 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)

Description: This ripe and mouthfilling wine shows a soft fruitiness, a nicely full body and laid-back pear flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Three Thieves 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: A slightly smoky, petrol aroma and lip-smacking apricot flavors help this light-bodied wine stand out. It's a bit earthy and unorthodox but fun to drink.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Josh Cellars 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Description: Fir honey, dried pear and fruitcake exude their warm, sweet perfume on the nose of this wine. The honeyed palate brims with dried-fruit intensity that encompasses fig, sultana and pear, with Christmas spice richness. Hints of sandalwood and vanilla lend smoothness and even more aroma. A bright vein of lemon purity leaves a pure notion of dried fig on the long finish. It's a SGN of rare balance and beauty. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Designation: Clos Jebsal Sélection de Grains Nobles
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Jebsal Sélection de Grains Nobles Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A notion of freshly cut pear peel has the gentlest creaminess on the nose of this wine. The palate brims with similarly pure fresh fruit while the texture recalls russet-pear peel and citrus zest. Mild freshness pervades and brightens the flavors. The dry finish is luminous and long, as well as uncommonly fresh for 2018. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2018 Zellberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a flash of freshly cut Williams pear shows befor the nose closes down again. The palate reveals gentle, rounded fruit and the kind of concentration that turns into elegance rather than power. With plenty of energy at the core, sun-ripened and upright, the wine remains finely chiseled. A freshness uncommon for 2018 pervades the pear notes and lets this shine. Drink by 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Cuvée Ste. Cathérine Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, notions of honeyed, baked pear with clove are tender at first but becomes full-blown on the concentrated palate. The honeyed edge and distinct sweetness are countered by concentrated freshness, creating a sweet late-harvest wine of precision, purity and poise. Sweetness enhances the touches of pear, spice and honey, leaving lasting traces. Drink by 2050.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Jebsal Vendange Tardive Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Flinty reduction hovers on the nose of this wine like a promise of longevity. On the palate, residual carbon dioxide heightens freshness before ripe, yellow pear takes over. This wine is juicy and bold, with a lovely tone of saffron spice edged with a hint of zestiness. Despite its energy and power, the wine remains taut and linear. The textured midpalate maximizes the sense of drive on the dry finish. Drink to 2040.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2018 Réserve Personnelle Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The creamy juiciness of freshly cut, ripe Williams pear dances appetizingly on the nose of this wine. Fruit purity is also apparent on the palate, imbued by vivid, rounded juiciness and supported by a lovely backdrop of pithy, slightly phenolic texture. This adds grace and backbone and lets the juicy pear notes express themselves fully. The finish is wonderfully dry and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Clos Windsbuhl Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Restrained zestiness and a sense of russet-pear peel is all the shy nose gives away for now. The palate of this wine comes in with freshness supported by the liveliness of some residual carbon dioxide, and a richer, almost buttery notion of pear fruit. Vivacity has the upper hand, especially on the sprightly finish that tapers from the rounded fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Rotenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Funky smokiness still obscures any fruit on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with uncommon concentration and unusual freshness for a 2018. Homing in on stoniness rather than fruit, the wine channels energy and power towards its lasting, dry and fresh finish. Drink by 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kirrenbourg SAS 2018 Roche Granitique Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Flint, smoke, chalk and cream all appear in brief flashes on the nose of this wine. The palate still holds some residual carbon dioxide but then slowly reveals serene and ripe but bright pear fruit at its core. Freshness takes its cue from a pithy texture and lends shape to this bold but fresh, bone-dry wine. Drink until 2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2018 Roche Calcaire Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Classic varietal aromas of crushed tomato vine, exotic fruit and wild herb almost jump out of the glass. On the vibrant, savory palate, tangy acidity underscores pineapple, grapefruit and green melon, while an energizing mineral note evoking saline lingers on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Venica & Venica 2019 Ronco del Cerò Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A hint of dried pear is slight but pure on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with spirited dryness, freshness, linear concentration and elegance. On the finish, a richer, almost buttery note rounds things out. This classy wine should be long-lived. Drink by 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Josmeyer 2017 Le Fromenteau Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This elevated Pinot Gris offers textured minerality from fermentation in a concrete egg, and fresh, layered fruit flavors of citrus flesh and rind. There's ample acidity as well, and it sets an example for a strikingly unique style.                      Paul Gregutt
Designation: Steiner Block Estate Grown Certified Biodynamic
Name: King Estate 2018 Steiner Block Estate Grown Certified Biodynamic Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aromas of Alpine herb, white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit mingle together in the glass. Tangy and rounded, the savory palate boasts intense flavor and finesse, doling out ripe yellow pear, white peach and a hint of green melon alongside fresh acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Jermann 2019 Pinot Grigio (Friuli)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is a blend of top barrels from five different vineyards, and offers the sort of layered complexity that argues for Pinot Gris as a top-tier, world-class variety. Well-integrated fruit flavors of apple and pear, with mixed spices and a dash of vanilla, keep expanding and leaving a nuanced impression through the long finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Backbone Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The shy nose on this wine allows mere glimpses of russet-pear peel and citrus zest. The palate preserves this zinginess but beds it on juicy, generous pear fruit. It has lovely concentration and those lively pear notes seem to radiate ripeness and sunny joy. Meanwhile the finish is balanced, poised and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Rosenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A gentle lick of creamy vanilla plays on the nose of this wine. The palate intensifies this creaminess and adds notes of chalky earth and fresh, white field mushroom. Something unctuous and generous shifts the focus from fruit onto texture on this powerful but balanced and rounded wine. The extended finish is dry and fresh. Drink by 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2016 Silb Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Only a hint of freshly cut, ripe pear peel appears briefly on the nose of this wine. The palate presents a precise picture of concentrated ripe, green pear that comes with purity, precision and restraint. All the fruit is there, but rather than rounding out, it soars with freshness, which is a real achievement in 2018. The finish is dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Trimbach 2018 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Soléna kills it with this grape, and this is the best vintage yet. Classy wine styling is here on full display, with ripe and fleshy fruit flavors of pear and melon, alongside splendid details of cinnamon and toast. It's taken decades, but Oregon's best examples of Pinot Gris belong with the nation's top-tier white wines from any grape.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Soléna 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Brilliant Fuji apple and Anjou pear flavors light up this smooth and elegant, medium-bodied wine that was aged on its lees for five months. A silky mouthfeel and subtle acidity make it instantly appealing and hard to put down.                      Jim Gordon
Name: FEL 2019 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Description: Rich notes of baked pear on the nose of this wine are made even lusher by hints of marzipan and honey. The pear-fruited palate presents similar ripeness, but keeps its balance with the rounded generosity of spice, leading to an off-dry, but still fresh and creamy umami finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2016 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A gentle note of ripe, yellow pear is pure on the nose of this wine, with the slightest edge of hazelnut and cinnamon. The palate adds bright but rounded freshness while the finish remains dry, shining with purity and poise.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Ostertag 2018 les jardins Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The aromatic freshness of freshly cut Conference pear peel shines from the glass. The palate of this wine then presents riper and rounder pear fruit tinged and boosted with a dollop of sweetness, but also pervaded by vivid freshness. This wine is concentrated, bold, long and impressive, with a lasting, off-dry and resonant finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2017 Schlossberg Grand Cru Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This copper-colored wine has a perfumed nose evoking spring wildflowers and white stone fruit with whiffs of wild herb. The savory palate features juicy peach, white cherry and ginger notes alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Venica & Venica 2019 Jesera Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This top-tier vineyard does exceptionally well with its Sauvignon Blancs, and applies similar practices to this Pinot Gris. Spicy, leesy and loaded with citrus, apple and pear, it's a crisp, refreshing wine with a foundation of wet stones. Just a hint of residual sugar helps to round off the acids, but it's quite dry.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Croft Vineyards 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Notes of hay and fresh pear play subtly on the shy nose of this dry wine. The palate adds apple freshness and lemon overtones. There is concentration and lovely, pithy midpalate texture, and the finish is fresh and dry, a real achievement in 2018. This lovely wine will evolve. Drink to 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Fernand Engel 2018 Renaissance Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of chalk and hay accompany pear on the nose of this wine, with an overtone of dried yarrow. The palate holds the richness of ripe pear and comes with a pleasant phenolic texture. This wine has lovely balance and weight, shows ample freshness, and finishes off dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gérard Neumeyer 2015 Schaefferstein Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A very shy nose on this wine gives next to nothing away. The palate, however, comes in with intense creaminess that has an edge of melted butter. It sits well with the rich, rounded pear fruit that dominates the midpalate. Gentle freshness frames the fruit and spells elegance. Power, spice and length become apparent on the dry finish. Leave this for a while and drink 2022–2035.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Weinbach 2018 Clos des Capucins Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle pear notes on the nose of this wine shine with purity and subtlety. The palate adds a pithy, textured mouthfeel that channels the bold but dry richness. Freshness frames the finesse at the core of this bold wine. Drink until 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2018 Evidence Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A slight but aromatic hint of russet-pear peel on the nose of this wine promises ripeness. With more air subtle creaminess appears. The palate offers smoothness and rounded and ripe but gentle pear notes. There is as much concentration as there is mellowness and the long, dry finish sets an elegant tone.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Letzenberg Gastronomie Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: An ethereal lift of hayflower hovers above the pear-fruited nose on this wine. The palate then combines delicacy and bundled power, with a lovely, yeasty texture on the concentrated midpalate. It has a wonderfully funky but dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Marc Kreydenweiss 2018 Lerchenberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Leesy, textural, lemony and anchored in a crushed rock tone, this tasty wine is from a Chehalem Mountains vineyard, though labeled simply Willamette Valley. The flavors round out nicely on the palate in citrus and apple fruit tones, with pretty accents of vanilla wafer and macaroon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Johnson School Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A rich, palate-coating yet high-acid style, this is loaded with bright flavors of citrus, nectarines and apples. It's a fruit-fest for sure, and if you love a zippy, acid-driven white wine, this is sure to please.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Croft Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: In this wine, the shy nose reveals just a subtle creaminess. All the flavors come alive on the palate. Rounded, gently sweet pear is balanced by a pithy, insistent texture pervaded by juiciness. The finish is long, medium dry and juicy.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2017 Lieu-dit Trottacker de Ribeauville Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine shows only glimpses of pear fruit. The palate, however, offers russet-pear peel and textured, concentrated pithiness. Gentle pear notes soften the picture while admirable freshness lifts everything. This wine is dry, powerful and expressive. Lovely now it will develop. Drink by 2030.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Pfister 2018 Furd Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notions of freshly cut green-pear peel have citric lift on the nose of this wine. The palate adds rounded, ripe pear notes that provide the dry, lively palate with juiciness. A pithy texture adds to the enjoyment.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Albert Mann 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe pear and yellow apple are subtle on the nose of this wine. The palate imbues the pear flavors with rounded richness. The mouthfeel is smooth and rounded, with a gentle freshness. It's elegant, echoing with a long, just off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Agathe Bursin 2018 Dirstelberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lifted freshness and an ethereal hay-flower note suggest both liveliness and some evolution. The palate adds a rounded, generous mouthfeel, creating a palate of juicy pear and bright lemon. This bold wine stays poised and fresh. The dry finish is most appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Unique among the winery's portfolio of six or more different versions of Pinot Gris, this is oak-aged. The barrel time smooths out the flavors, while imparting a lightly buttery, toasty accent. Scents of clover and fruit flavors of apple and citrus fill out the palate. Note to stamp collectors: the label is printed upside down on purpose!                      Paul Gregutt
Name: King Estate 2018 Paradox Barrel Aged Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
