Description: Gentle hints of russet-pear peel and ripe, yellow pear on the nose of this wine lead to a bone-dry body where concentration and texture reign. Zesty freshness comes with a pithy midpalate. The finish is elegant and lasting.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2017 Les Éléments Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe pear notes on the nose of this wine have something creamy and subtle about them. The palate continues in the same, mellow vein, imbuing the fruit with gentle but concentrated texture, creaminess and almost a hint of vanilla. Freshness counters and leaves a just off-cry, creamy and fruity finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2016 Patergarten Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pure and bold notes of freshly cut russet-pear peel fill the nose on this wine. The palate adds flowing pear juiciness and concentration. Bold fruitiness is held in check by pithy, not quite zesty freshness. This wine has drive and energy, with a just off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: René Muré 2018 Pierres Sèches Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The unusual moniker, Winemaker Bruno Corneaux explains, is the traditional Burgundian name for Pinot Gris. Fermented in neutral oak and left on the lees until bottling, this is a smooth, supple wine, with lovely flavors of cut pear and apple cobbler. The texture and lingering fruit flavors suggest drinking this while young, though it should age well through 2025.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Domaine Divio 2019 Beurot Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Hints of hay accompany pear notes on the nose of this wine, along with subtle creaminess. On the palate the pear fruit comes through with juiciness and verve. The off-dry finish sits well with the balanced, fresh fruit and bold concentration.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Gresser 2018 Brandhof Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: There's some extra concentration in the reserve, which retains the tart, bracing freshness of the regular bottling. Fermented in a mix of neutral oak puncheons and concrete, it's loaded with gooseberry, citrus, lemon rind and minerals.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2019 Reserve Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A subtle, toned-down nose speaks gently of summer blossom and creaminess. The palate of this wine blossoms into ripe peach surrounded by mandarin freshness and honeysuckle spiciness. Juiciness at the core and a pleasant, mouthwatering bitterness intensifies the moreishness. The medium-dry finish rings long with Damask rose.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Leon Beyer 2017 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas evoking hawthorn and cantaloupe mingle with scents of Alpine herb on this savory, structured Pinot Grigio. On the rounded palate, fresh acidity lifts mature pear, Rennet apple and a hint of nectarine. It closes on a saline note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Schiopetto 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This sensational wine was sourced from old-vine plantings at the Lavelle vineyard. It's breathtakingly floral, with an elegant frame that dapples scents of clover around tart fruit flavors of apple and peach. It was fermented in a mix of stainless tanks and neutral barrels. Enjoy this over the next two years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Fullerton 2019 Three Otters Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aromas of elderflower and green melon lead the nose along with a hint of hay. On the medium-bodied palate, a note of honeyed almond accompanies mature pear and ripe apple. Tangy acidity lifts the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: The shy nose on this wine allows only glimpses of russet-pear peel but the palate presents ripe pear fruit in all its glory. Juicy, rounded and mellow, the wine is boosted by a touch of sweetness and supported by gentle creaminess. It is a mellow, full but also balanced wine with an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: François Baur 2018 Herrenweg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Lightly scented, this vibrant white offers delicate aromas of white stone fruit and spring wildflowers. It's racy and chiseled, featuring apple, pear and ginger flavors before a crisp, mineral finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Beeswax, fresh pollen and white stone fruit aromas waft out of the glass. The tangy, polished palate offers mature Bartlett pear, yellow apple and citrus drop candy before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Rajade 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Bitter almond and pear are aromatic and promising on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with rounded but defined richness and a smooth texture. The finish is dry, lasting and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Agapé 2017 Expression Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of yellow, ripe pear are fresh on the nose of this wine. The palate has an almost honeyed sweetness that turns the fresh fruit from the nose into mellow and rich dried pear. A lovely bitter pithiness adds texture and frames the richness. The finish is medium sweet and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Turckheim 2017 Collection Terroirs Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Beeswax, fresh pollen and white stone fruit aromas waft out of the glass. The tangy, polished palate offers mature Bartlett pear, yellow apple and citrus drop candy before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Rajade 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Bitter almond and pear are aromatic and promising on the nose of this wine. The palate comes in with rounded but defined richness and a smooth texture. The finish is dry, lasting and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Agapé 2017 Expression Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Spring blossom and summer orchard fruit aromas are front and center. On the savory, linear palate, tangy acidity accompanies Bartlett pear, Granny Smith apple and white peach before a white almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Russiz 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: A heady, almost lifted hint of Williams pear hovers over ripe yellow-pear notes on the nose of this wine. The palate frames this fruit with easy charm on a juicy, rounded palate that brims with richness. Bright freshness dominates the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2019 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine has faint overtones of bitter almond. The palate brings concentration and freshness, with ample bright but ripe pear fruit and more of that lovely almond bitterness that sits well with the rounded generosity and full body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This delicious young wine is a close match to the company's less expensive ‘Greetings' version. Ripe pear fruit, along with some crisp apple, highlights a clean and fresh-tasting style, while the supporting acids lend a squeeze of lemon. Drink over the next couple of years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Second Growth 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The shy nose on this wine has faint overtones of bitter almond. The palate brings concentration and freshness, with ample bright but ripe pear fruit and more of that lovely almond bitterness that sits well with the rounded generosity and full body.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Paul Blanck 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe but fresh yellow pear appear on the shy nose of this wine. The palate imbues them with more freshness and fruit, creating a sense of concentrated freshness, balance and ripe ease. Restrained zestiness makes the just off-dry finish more vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe Conference pear is pristine on the nose of this wine. The palate holds the same ripe freshness, adding a slightly textured creamy note, balancing freshness and a hint of baking spice. It is off dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wolfberger 2019 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of spring blossoms waft out of the glass. Bright and savory, the palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, lemon drop candy and an inviting hint of bread dough alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Borgo Conventi 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Aromas of white stone fruit and chamomile shape the nose along with a yeasty whiff of bread crust. On the racy palate, crisp acidity accompanies mature pear, white cherry and a dollop of vanilla before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castello di Spessa 2018 Joy Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Pure and vivid notes of ripe, juicy yellow pear fill the nose with the very first whiff. The palate of this wine continues this vividness, delivering a veritable pear party on the palate. Lovely texture assures structure while freshness balances the bouncy fruitiness of the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Emile Beyer 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of green pear and russet-pear peel promise freshness on the nose of this wine. The palate delivers on a concentrated, subtly fruited body that has an almost zesty element, but is also ripe and powerful. It is dry, bold and lasting on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henry Fuchs 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: So young and fresh it's still got a bit of light fizz (CO2) going on, this is a bracing wine, with lemon verbena, green apple, lemon oil and a palate-cleansing minerality. Made for early drinking, it's best with a light chill.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Lange 2019 Classiqué Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is fresh, clean and fruit forward, with flavors of pear and apple. The texture is spot on, keeping the fruit lively across the palate, and the wine finishes with a hint of wet stone.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Conveyance 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Only the merest hint of ripe, yellow pear appears on the shy nose of this wine. The palate comes in with bright, easy and rounded freshness. Gentle concentration provides lovely texture. The dry finish reinforces the elegance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Mellow pear richness on the nose of this wine sets the tone for the juicy, generous palate. Bright freshness provides a counterpoint and makes sure that the wine stays on the refreshing, vivid side. The finish is just off dry and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Frey 2019 Symbiose Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a shy nose gives hints of russet-pear peel but concentration seems already implied. The palate shows intensity and mild juiciness. With its gentle pear fruit, the wine is just off dry but exquisitely balanced.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Schoffit 2018 Lieu-dit Harth Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine reveals attractive glimpses of ripe but fresh pear. The palate sweeps in with freshness at first, illuminating the subtle texture, but then adds a hint of rounded fruit sweetness to come to an off-dry but very balanced finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Sipp Mack 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle hints of citrus and pear are all that escape on the shy nose of this wine. On the palate the pear notes take on a full-fruited, rounded generosity and ripeness, boosted by a hint of residual sweetness. A lovely yeasty, phenolic texture counteracts alongside juicy freshness, leading to a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Wunsch & Mann 2017 Cuvée de la Reine Clotilde Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Faint hints of yellow pear are subtle but promising on the nose of this wine. The palate fully fleshes out these juicy notes of yellow pear. It offers ripeness, gentle sweetness, subtle aroma and bright freshness. Pure and lasting, the flavors show a hint of chalky hinterland, while the finish is medium dry and long.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2017 Herrenreben Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe, yellow-pear flesh almost have a floral overtone on the nose of this wine. The palate intensifies this mellow juiciness by adding a hint of sweetness to the concentrated palate. This sits well with the mellow but fresh flavors and leads to a juicy, off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Scharsch 2017 Clos Saint Materne Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a subtle nose makes shy promises of ripe pear. Ripe, fresh pear duly appears on the concentrated palate where gentle freshness highlights the pithy, not quite zesty texture and adds verve to the fruit. The wine has lovely balance and a freshness that was not easy to achieve in 2018. It is dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The wine is much better than the looks of the label might suggest. It's packed with ripe flavors of sliced Bartlett pears, with that slightly grainy texture also. Though there isn't a whole lot more going on, the basic fruit is so good, clean and lingering, that it's more than sufficient as a fine all-purpose white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Greetings 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The wine is much better than the looks of the label might suggest. It's packed with ripe flavors of sliced Bartlett pears, with that slightly grainy texture also. Though there isn't a whole lot more going on, the basic fruit is so good, clean and lingering, that it's more than sufficient as a fine all-purpose white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Greetings 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: In this wine, notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose promise juiciness and freshness. Delivering on both counts, the palate presents an easy and appetizing core of green and yellow pear. The rounded body preserves freshness that brightens the dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Hugel 2018 Classic Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Tangy and delicious, this vibrant white opens with delicate scents of spring blossoms and white stone fruit. On the crisp palate, fresh acidity accompanies green apple, white peach and fennel.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kettmeir 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: The shy nose on this wine keeps its secrets for now, showing only a hint of ripe pear. The palate comes in with the subtle richness of baked pear, freshness and gentle spice. A mellow fruit balance gives roundness and texture. The finish is off dry and bright.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Trois Châteaux Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: In this wine, a subtle nose makes shy promises of ripe pear. Ripe, fresh pear duly appears on the concentrated palate where gentle freshness highlights the pithy, not quite zesty texture and adds verve to the fruit. The wine has lovely balance and a freshness that was not easy to achieve in 2018. It is dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Charles Baur 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pear notes are subtle but fresh on the nose of this wine. The palate shows more ripe pear fruit that's rounded, medium bodied and off dry. It's a mellow but balanced wine.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: André Kientzler 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fresh pear and Golden Delicious apple promise fruity ripeness on the nose of this wine. The palate adds rounded mellowness as well as a lovely, textured phenolic edge that gives contour to the generous fruit. It is off dry and fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This pale yellow Tasmanian Pinot Gris is a smartly put together summer sipper. With delicate stone fruit, floral and ground ginger notes throughout, it's crisp, balanced and refreshing, if not exactly bursting with personality.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Holm Oak 2018 Pinot Gris (Tasmania)

Description: In this wine, a shy nose only allows a slight notion of fresh apple and the palate shows a similar subtlety. But the wine has brightness and a generous, juicy mouthfeel that leaves the impression of ripe, yellow pear. The finish is fresh and appetizing.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Sauvage Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Spring blossom, ripe orchard fruit and botanical herb aromas form the inviting nose. Round and medium bodied, the dry palate shows Bartlett pear, apple and a hint of white almond accompanied by tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigna del Lauro 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Only faint hints of pear show on the closed nose of this wine. The palate, however, presents generous, ripe yellow-pear notes. A vein of freshness adds juiciness and a hint of almond spice.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2018 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe russet-pear notes are vivid on the nose of this wine. The palate clings to these and comes in with juiciness and a little edge of baking spices. The mouthfeel is rounded and generous, with a fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine de la Tour Blanche 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of fresh pear and Golden Delicious apple promise fruity ripeness on the nose of this wine. The palate adds rounded mellowness as well as a lovely, textured phenolic edge that gives contour to the generous fruit. It is off dry and fresh on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Bestheim 2018 Anne de K. Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Spring blossom, ripe orchard fruit and botanical herb aromas form the inviting nose. Round and medium bodied, the dry palate shows Bartlett pear, apple and a hint of white almond accompanied by tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Vigna del Lauro 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Only faint hints of pear show on the closed nose of this wine. The palate, however, presents generous, ripe yellow-pear notes. A vein of freshness adds juiciness and a hint of almond spice.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Willm 2018 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Ripe white stone fruit and spring blossom aromas waft out of the glass on this medium-bodied white along with a whiff of sea breeze. The vibrant palate offers ripe pear, saline and white almond alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: White spring blossoms and Granny Smith apple waft out of the glass along with an inviting, subtle whiff evoking bread dough. Bright and savory, the medium-bodied palate shows Bartlett pear, green melon and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Sturm 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: The generous nose on this wine is mellow with baked pear. That same rich fruit characterizes the palate where it carries an edge of marzipan bitterness. Freshness counters but leaves a rounded, full-bodied wine with an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: W. Gisselbrecht 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Generous ripeness is already apparent on the juicy, almost tropically inflected notes of pear on the nose of this wine. Juicy, mellow and fresh, the palate comes with creaminess that accentuates the richness. The finish is off dry and mellow.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Allimant-Laugner 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The closed nose on this wine reveals only the slightest hint of pear peel. Next the palate comes in with textured, pleasant pithiness and slight bitterness that works well within the full-fruited pear generosity. The finish is dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Pierre Sparr 2018 Grande Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: High Valley, Lake County, California, US
Description: A charming floral aroma and abundant honeydew-melon flavors give this medium-bodied wine plenty to like. A nicely rounded texture is braced by subtle acidity for a clean mouthfeel.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Brassfield 2019 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Gris (High Valley)

Description: The richness of the ripe pear fruit becomes apparent on the generous nose of this wine. The palate gives full rein to this rounded pear generosity, amplified by medium sweetness. The richness remains balanced and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Ribeauvillé 2017 Collection Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Freshness and the fruity ease of ripe pear show on the nose of this wine. The palate completes the picture with ripe and bright pear fruit. There is something summery and bright about this, despite the full-bodied generosity. The finish is dry and vivid.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Gustave Lorentz 2019 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Vivid notes of melted butter and baked pear on the nose of this wine immediately spell richness. The palate delivers and adds aromatic baking spices as well as an almond bitterness. This wine offers rounded, mellow but dry richness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Louis & Fabienne Mann 2017 Eguisheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Smooth fruit flavors of pear and peach come with a spicy, lightly peppery kick. This was fermented entirely in stainless steel, and has enough bottle age to be approaching its best drinking window.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Compton Family 2018 Garden Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Hints of ripe, yellow pear just peek through on the shy nose of this wine. The palate sweeps in with the ripe juiciness of yellow pear, adding lovely phenolic pithiness that provides texture and direction. Subtle freshness highlights the beautifully dry and concentrated finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaines Schlumberger 2018 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: A subtle hint of aromatic Williams pear flashes on the otherwise shy nose of this wine. Sweeping in with juicy fruitfulness, the palate presents abundant ripe, yellow pear that captures the generosity of 2018. The finish is just off dry and vividly fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Jean Sipp 2018 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The subtle nose on this wine combines ripe yellow apple and green pear. An almost zesty, green-pear-peel freshness on the palate provides texture. It's a vividly fresh and balanced wine with an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Robert Klingenfus 2019 Signature Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Pure notes of green Conference pear are evocative on the nose of this wine. They become more intense on the palate and seem to gain ripeness. A pithy texture adds richness to the ripeness and generosity. The finish is fresh and dry.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Lucien Albrecht 2019 Cuvée Romanus Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting spring blossoms and orchard fruit. On the medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity accompanies honeydew and green apple before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Primosic 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Subtle notes of ripe and mellow baked pear appear gently on the nose of this wine. The palate also presents this mix of freshness and roundness, adding juiciness to boost the fruit. It is off dry and appetizing on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2018 Les Natures Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe yellow pear on the nose of this wine promise juiciness. The palate delivers with rounded, bouncy pear fruit on a body that is juicy and just about off dry. With a lovely balance of freshness and fruit, the wine has a lasting finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Boeckel 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Gentle notes of ripe, juicy russet pear rise from the glass. The palate of this wine comes in with gentle roundness, framing the ripe pear with generosity. Subtle freshness counters the mellow finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave de Cleebourg 2017 Grande Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The gentle freshness of green but ripe pear plays subtly on the nose of this wine. Continuing in this bright vein, the palate adds mellow fruitiness. The effect is juicy and rounded, but all remains fresh. It is off dry and bright on the finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2018 Découverte Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Showing definite sweetness on the palate, this skirts the border of off dry. Honey, ripe pears, peaches and a streak of vanilla complete a full-bodied, well-rounded and fruit-forward style. It would be interesting to try this with a slice of peach pie or pear tart.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cória 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The closed nose on this wine gives next to nothing away. However, the palate presents a juicy flow of pear fruitiness. The body is mellow and fresh. Underneath flashes of orange juiciness lead to a just-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Rittersberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The closed nose on this wine gives next to nothing away. However, the palate presents a juicy flow of pear fruitiness. The body is mellow and fresh. Underneath flashes of orange juiciness lead to a just-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frey-Sohler 2018 Rittersberg Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The shy nose on this wine gives away nothing but a hint of freshness. On the palate, ripe, pear-fruited generosity becomes apparent. The finish has a lovely apple-pip note and freshness.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Joseph Cattin 2018 Grand C Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Creamy, almost buttery notes of pear dominate the nose on this wine and give a sense of richness. The creaminess continues on the rounded, mellow palate that has a distinct sense of maple-syrup spice and almond bitterness. This mellow, generously fruited and spiced wine comes together on the medium-sweet finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kuentz-Bas 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Showing definite sweetness on the palate, this skirts the border of off dry. Honey, ripe pears, peaches and a streak of vanilla complete a full-bodied, well-rounded and fruit-forward style. It would be interesting to try this with a slice of peach pie or pear tart.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Cória 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Vivid notes of baked pear and pear compote immediately fill the nose on this wine. The palate capitalizes on this fruit with mellow, flowing juiciness delivered in a light package. The finish is off dry and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Jean Biecher & Fils 2019 Réserve Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine is shy, offering mellow notes of ripe pear. These become more pronounced on the rounded palate where generosity and freshness create good balance. The finish is off dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Specht 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Cienega Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: There's an alkaline streak across the nose of this bottling, which offers dried honeysuckle and lanolin aromas as well. Dried lemon peel and quinine elements show on the palate, which is likely to blossom into other flavors with time.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Eden Rift 2018 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)

Description: Invitingly crisp and floral, this white wine is tropical with a fleshy opulence and lasting note of sweet vanilla.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Folie à Deux 2019 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)

Description: Faint hints of mellow baked apple appear gently on the nose of this wine. Brimming with juiciness, the palate presents ripe yellow apple and luscious pear. The finish is medium dry and full of rich, mellow fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Roland Schmitt 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The color is a light tawny straw, and the aromas have a pleasantly dusty spiciness. The fruit reflects the flavors of early oxidation, with autumnal apples and hints of pollen and clover. It's quite nice but should be consumed over the next year or two.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Montinore 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: A solid, fruity wine, this mixes crisp apple and white-peach flavors. It continues along that path and into a finish that displays some phenolic bite and skin tannins.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Alexana 2019 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Broad, palate-coating flavors of lemon cake lead a smooth and lightly spicy wine. There's a suggestion of mashed pears also. The wine was fermented and aged in stainless, and kept on the lees for a full year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2018 Ellis Vineyards Block 1 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Description: A subtle hint of yellow pear is all that can be discerned on the nose of this wine. The palate, however, comes in with ease and brightness. A juicy, balanced midpalate leads to an off-dry but vividly fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Henri Schoenheitz 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Broad, palate-coating flavors of lemon cake lead a smooth and lightly spicy wine. There's a suggestion of mashed pears also. The wine was fermented and aged in stainless, and kept on the lees for a full year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pebblestone 2018 Ellis Vineyards Block 1 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Ripe pear fruit, drizzled with a squeeze of lemon, incorporates a subtle grainy, fleshy mouthfeel. It's clean and straightforward, a solid example of classic Oregon Pinot Gris. Drink over the next two vintages while it's at its freshest.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Apolloni 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Only subtle hints of pear ripeness appear on the shy nose of this wine. The palate comes in with ease but also with brightness. Pear notes have an earthy tinge and a textured mouthfeel while the finish remains dry and fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Frédéric Mallo 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle fruity freshness on the nose of this wine sets a vivid tone. The rounded palate is juicy and mellow, and comes together on a medium-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Koenig Vins Alsace 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Vivid, generous notes of baked apple and pear abound on the nose of this wine. The medium-sweet palate continues this apple and pear theme and adds a creamy, spicy element so that the overall effect suggests pear crumble. It's a rounded, generous wine with tons of fruit.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Armand Hurst 2018 Baronne Tonia de Turckheim Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Notes of juicy yellow pear dominate the nose on this wine. The palate comes in with a light, easy step that seems weightless and refreshing. The gentle fruity flavors lead to a dry, fresh finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine G. Metz 2018 Cuvée Melody Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine brims with notes of honeyed pear crumble and baked apple, signaling sweetness from the start. On the palate, rounded, medium-sweet richness illuminates every nuance of that ripe pear fruit. The body is fresh and mellow, and the finish medium sweet and rich.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Michel Fonne 2018 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: The nose on this wine is chock-full of ripe, juicy pear fruit. Conveying equal juiciness, the rounded and fruity palate has just a little pithiness. The finish is fresh and fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Domaine Zinck 2018 Portrait Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes and packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this has aromas of tropical fruit and green apple. On the racy, rather lean palate, crisp acidity accompanies suggestions of green melon, Granny Smith apple and a hint of citrus.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Monte Zovo 2019 Wolhlgemuth Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: A whiff of green pear comes and goes on the shy nose of this wine. Notions of russet-pear peel and a pithy texture show on the palate. The mouthfeel is rich and rounded, and the generous fruit is countered by freshness on the off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Robert Karcher et Fils 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Aromas of banana and Granny Smith apple follow over the palate along with ripe honeydew. Bright acidity keeps it fresh and tangy.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Produttori di Cormons 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Despite swirling, the closed nose on this wine is not ready to give much away. On the palate, the roundness and juiciness of ripe pear gets proper billing. This wine is easy and generous, with a medium finish that leaves just the right balance.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Ruhlmann 2018 Tête de Cuvée Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Easy notes of baked pear fill the nose on this wine. The palate comes in with the same mellowness, presenting generous pear fruit, rounded freshness and an off-dry finish.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Philippe Sohler 2018 Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Delicate scents of spring wildflowers, white stone fruit and a hint of nut form the subtle nose. On the palate, bright acidity accompanies pear, candied tangerine slice and bitter almond.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: In this wine, a very shy nose reveals just a hint of pear. The palate presents itself in a similarly muted fashion, showing some pear fruit and freshness, with a mellow, juicy mouthfeel. The finish is dryish but fresh.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Anne & Marc Wassler 2018 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Gris (Alsace)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking beeswax and spring flowers form the delicate nose. On the linear palate, bright acidity accompanies mature yellow pear and a savory, saline-like mineral note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pighin 2019 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: The aromas of whole pear, wet stone and apple are followed by light bright pear flavors. It's a straight-down-the-fairway offering of this variety, with acid driving it.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Primarius 2019 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This has a shy nose that eventually offers mere whiffs of yellow wildflowers and white stone fruit. The palate is also subdued, suggesting mature peach before a bitter almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2018 Pinot Grigio (Collio)

Description: Banana and elderflower aromas leap to the forefront. The banana note follows on the tangy palate along with green apple and tangy acidity. It's simple but well-made.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Villa Girardi 2019 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Red Mountain, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Despite its age, this wine is a bit reductive out of the gate. Aromas of cut apple and melon lead to medium-sweet full-bodied oxidized red-apple flavors. It doesn't have the acid to balance the sugar.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Convergence Zone 2017 Drizzle Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Pinot Gris (Red Mountain)

Description: This simple white has a shy nose offering whiffs of spring flowers and white stone fruit. It's bright and informal, offering suggestions of green apple and citrus alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tommasi 2019 Le Rosse Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Swiss-born Hans Herzog's Old World-style wines, made from his 26 organically farmed grape varieties, sing of both the land and the man. Ultralow yields and long skin contact make this amber wine—the color of a flaming, pink-tinted sunset—extraordinarily unique in New Zealand. The evocative nose smells like a summer evening: grilled nectarines and figs, honeysuckle, beeswax and warm stones. It's gorgeously complex and mineral, with layers of flavor and texture. The alcohol is a touch high, but overall it pulses with energy, unfurling over time and proving Pinot Gris capable of greatness Down Under. Drink now–2030.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Hans Family Estate 2017 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Appellation: Anderson Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: This wine is really substantive. It's alive with mineral and fresh-bread aromas, tangy fruit and dried meat flavors, and offers lively acidity to support the depth of flavor.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Windchaser 2018 Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)

Appellation: San Luis Obispo County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light and ashy on the nose, this wine starts with red and yellow apple as well as melon and intense lemon peel. There's great acidity and tension to the sip, where a river-stone minerality converges with tangerine peel and lemon rind.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Claiborne & Churchill 2018 Spanish Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (San Luis Obispo County)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Left on the skins long enough to bring a robust copper gold color to the wine, you might call this an amalgam of white, orange and rosé wine attributes. By any measure it's rich and delicious, with soft, slightly candied citrus peel and mixed fruitcake flavors.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Big Table Farm 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fruity and rich, this wine offers a light but pleasant oaky scent. It is buttery and textured on the palate, with flavors of green apple and melon.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: The Four Graces 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A generous wine, this is bursting with fresh, ripe pear fruit, lightly dusted with red pepper. The structure and details are impressive, with suggestions of lime, green melon and cucumber. Drink now through the early 2020s.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: J Wrigley 2018 Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This crisp and delicious wine is packed with freshly cut apple fruit flavors. Backed with zippy acidity, the wine shows exceptional focus, concentration and persistence. This is a perfect all-purpose white wine when you need a break from oaky Chardonnays.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Van Duzer 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fresh and leesy, as is the style for all of the winery's white wines, this brings crisp flavors of apple flesh and peel. It's focused and nicely balanced, with lovely mineral highlights.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: St. Innocent 2017 Vitae Springs Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Nutty and bright, this is a sleek, acid-focused and fresh white wine with earthy minerality. It showcases deft aromas of white flowers and citrus while leading to a core of succulent peach and melon.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Keller Estate 2018 La Cruz Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Description: This is a lovely, dry example of Marlborough Pinot Gris without too much winemaking trickery. A delicately perfumed nose of honeysuckle, hibiscus and pear leads to a palate that is textural yet refreshing, expressing the variety's gentle floral and orchard fruit characters. A touch of bitterness at the finish distracts slightly, but overall this is a solid bottling of this style from a sensitive producer.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Huia 2019 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)

Description: A lick of creamy vanilla on the nose has the slightest touch of smoke. The palate then reinforces those vanilla notions with a rich creaminess, making hints of subtle, ripe pear almost emollient. This is lovely now but will evolve. Drink by 2025.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Artisan Wines DI Franz Schneider 2018 Reserve Grauburgunder (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Tones of freshly cut pear and apple shine brightly in this ready-to-drink, young wine. The fruit is the whole show here and should be enjoyed while it remains balanced and pure.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Rogue Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: A solidly fruity wine, it's loaded with pear flesh and texture, balanced against fresh and proportionate acids. Not a complex wine, but clean and quite flavorful.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Del Rio 2018 Pinot Gris (Rogue Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The fresh pear fruit is vivid and crisp as an autumn breeze. The fruit is lightly dappled with black pepper. Though not a complex wine, it's immensely refreshing, with a slightly high-toned burst at the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Portlandia 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Lovely herbal flavors adorn crisp apple and Asian pear in this wine. The overall palate impression is of an elegant, sophisticated feel, with herbal notes that complement rather than dominate.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Kings Ridge 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: From estate-grown fruit, this is a stony, slatey white wine enveloped in flavors of apricot and a lightness of baking spice. Low in oak, it is juicy, fleshy and fully integrated.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Balletto 2019 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)

Description: Fleshy pear fruit immediately makes a good impression, and is punched up with vivid acids that add a touch of grapefruit. The wine takes a deep dive into a lingering, clean, fresh finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Primarius 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Description: This extroverted, ultrafloral wine from touristy Waiheke Island, near Auckland, won't be everyone's cup of tea. Still, many will be enchanted by its shiny, almost neon yellow color and intense perfume of jasmine and hyacinth, ginger hand soap, and honeycomb. There's a touch of sweetness on the palate, adding to its rich opulence, but enough freshness to make it easy to take another sip.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Man O' War 2017 Exiled Pinot Gris (Waiheke Island)

Description: Bold yellow-apple and lemon flavors are dusted by layers of crushed stone, nut and candle wax in this pert, dry Pinot Gris. Dry and medium bodied on the palate, it's a refreshing sip, with a tangy salt-rimmed finish. Best enjoyed now through 2027.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Friedrich Becker 2017 Becker Family Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Description: This is an elegant, structured Pinot Gris suggesting bright juicy apple and grapefruit flavors accented by toasted nuts and waxy citrus peels. Dry and full bodied in style, it's balanced by fresh acidity and a rim of bitters on the finish.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Salwey 2016 RS Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Dundee Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This strikes a balance among its crisp flavors of green apple, cucumber and lemon. The acids are substantial and refreshing, and it finishes sharp and peppery, with appealing minerality.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Winter's Hill 2017 Watershed Pinot Gris (Dundee Hills)

Description: Peardrop freshness and smooth creaminess are immediate on the nose. The light palate sets a lemony scene for the freshness and that creamy, smooth texture, leaving you with a sense of refreshing, creamy ease.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Steindorfer 2019 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Description: This Otago Pinot Gris opens bombastically, almost Gewürztraminer-like. It bursts with lemon zest and honeyed pears, waxy and woolly notes, and fistfuls of white flower blossoms. There's a lovely slippery texture on the palate, which is less extroverted than the nose suggests. A lifted line of slightly angular acidity and a finish of fruits and florals makes for a solid offering.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Wild Earth 2017 Pinot Gris (Central Otago)

Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Very tight on the nose, this bottling, which features an old-timey label from the family's deep history, offers tangerine and Meyer lemon pith on the nose along with a light brush of white flower and lime blossom. The palate produces wet stone flavors against nectarine, honeysuckle and a strong pink-grapefruit citrus element.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Bargetto 2018 Regan Vineyards Pinot Grigio (Santa Cruz Mountains)

Appellation: Chehalem Mountains, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This bottle is stuffed with flavors of apples and pears, varietally on target, with skin flavors adding texture. It sails into a crisp and fruity finish. There is nothing complicated about it, just good fruit well made.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Carabella 2018 Estate Pinot Gris (Chehalem Mountains)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Full bodied, round and fruity, this brings fleshy fruit flavors of pear and melon, with a splash of grapefruit. There's 2% Gewürztraminer included, and though the back label states that it's “Burgundian-style,” don't look for Chardonnay-type flavors here.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Firesteed 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Eola-Amity Hills, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Given a five-day cold soak prior to fermentation, this has picked up the color and characteristics of a rosé. Biodynamic grapes and wild yeasts add interesting texture, but there's a softness to the palate that suggests some oxidation has occurred. The flavors of candied fruit veer into orange wine territory. The wine is smooth and flavorful, but it's probably best to drink it over the next year.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Keeler 2018 Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Eola-Amity Hills)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is so light as to appear almost colorless, but it's not bereft of flavor. Lightly peppery hints of white melon, Asian pear and green apples construct a delicate palate that nonetheless offers plenty of flavor interest. The wine saw no oak and was not put through malolactic fermentation.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Provincial Vineyards 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Here is a solid, almost chunky wine, packed with fleshy pear and apple fruit. All-stainless fermented, it seems to have spent some time on the lees, as the texture reflects that creamy minerality. Drink now–2023.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Wine by Joe 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Fleshy pear fruit carries this appealing wine, lightly spiced and hinting at freshly picked green herbs. It's not quite as complex as the previous vintage, but nonetheless a delicious wine and a fine value.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Another can't-miss effort from the Union Wine Company, this light and versatile dry white wine offers crisp pear, apple and cucumber flavors, nicely annotated by an accent of thyme. It's an elegant, immaculately fresh wine, widely available at a good price.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Underwood 2018 Pinot Gris (Oregon)

Appellation: Monterey County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied green apple, honeydew and hints of jasmine show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers green touches of cut lawn and Granny Smith apple, but there is also a riper hint of red apple.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Noble Vines 2019 152 Pinot Grigio (Monterey County)

Description: With aromas of white peach and pineapple, this wine is soft in the mouth, with flavors of nectarine, apricot and rose petal. It offers a soft citrus finish.                      Mike DeSimone
Name: Dalton 2019 Estate Unoaked Pinot Gris (Galilee)

Description: Don't be put off by the box format. Floral aromas and ripe melon and citrus flavors dominate this enjoyable, medium- to full-bodied wine. It feels nicely round and mouthfilling in texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kirkland Signature 2019 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Bottled in the type of massive, deeply punted glass generally reserved for pricey reserve Cabernets, this seems to promise something special. Fermentation and aging in French oak puncheons has helped to smooth out the rough edges and high acids, without impacting flavors. It's totally dry and low in alcohol, with flavors of grapefruit, lemon and green apple.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Areté 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Clean aromas of nectarine and Pink Lady apple seem a bit sweet on the nose of this bottling. It tightens up on the sip, where crisp aromas of apple and pear are quite subtle, finishing with a brush of bubblegum.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Villa San-Juliette 2018 Pinot Gris (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Yakima Valley, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Aromas of slate, mango, cantaloupe and papaya lead to lighter-styled, dry fruit flavors. It brings a sense of elegance, not entirely standing on its own, but as a nice accent to a meal. Pair it with cashew-crusted halibut with a mango-kiwi salsa.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Freehand 2018 Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)

Description: A light shade of pink, this bottling begins with tightly wound aromas of brisk lemon spray and wet soil. It's refreshing on the palate with citrus peel and a slight pear flavor.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Maddalena 2019 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This all-stainless style is finished close to bone-dry, and the fruit lands squarely on lemon-lime flesh and rind flavors. It's juicy and quite tart, so best tasted with trout or other light seafood in a butter sauce.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Iris Vineyards 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aromas of white peach and citrus blossom lead to flavors of apricot, yellow peach and apple in the palate. It has good mouthfeel and the finish is soft and fruity.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Cramele Recas 2019 Legendary Estate Series Pinot Grigio (Transylvania)

Description: This wine is low key, full bodied and moderately fruity, offering light apple aromas and a good, lively texture.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Les Belles Collines 2018 Pinot Gris (California)

Description: This wine is clean and lean, offering light herb and crisp apple flavors on a light body. It provides good, simple refreshment.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Cliche 2019 Hybrid Pinot Grigio (Lodi)

Description: This medium-bodied wine is almost neutral in flavor: nothing to dislike but not much to appreciate. It has reasonable acidity and freshness and very simple, crisp apple flavors.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Harthill Farms NV Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Umpqua Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light and simple wine, with standard fruit flavors of pear flesh and skin. As an all-purpose white wine it's fine, though generic.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Melrose 2017 Pinot Gris (Umpqua Valley)

Description: This Pinot Grigio is straw colored, with aromas of apple blossom and lemon pith. It is light bodied, with flavors of Bartlett pear, grapefruit and pineapple. The finish has a touch of fruit sweetness.                      Jeff Jenssen
Name: Cramele Recas 2019 Paparuda Estate Selection Pinot Grigio (Romania)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is so light as to feel dilute, with generic fruit flavors that simply vanish. There's nothing wrong or off, just not much flavor.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Oak Knoll 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Adam Campbell's Pinot Gris is one of Oregon's best, year in and year out. A lush and vivid mix of grapefruit, lemon curd and candied orange peel, this new vintage both surprises and delights. Such complexity is rare in a grape mostly centered around apple and pear flavors—both are here, but in a back seat role. This unique mix is deliciously irresistible.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Elk Cove 2019 Estate Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: White melon and pear abound in this fresh, medium-bodied white. It's a juicy, unoaked wine lifted by layers of lemon and lime acidity but anchored by a subtle, smoky minerality that lingers, too. It's elegant yet effortlessly easy-drinking. Best enjoyed young.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Franz Keller 2018 Vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is bursting with scents and flavors of pear and grapefruit. Incredibly refreshing, it's textured and leesy, with appealing minerality and a long, clean, pour-me-more finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Portlandia 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Sharp toned at first, this smooths out with a bit of aeration, bringing up a tasty mix of apple, pear and lemon curd, with notes of vanilla and whipped cream. It was entirely whole-cluster fermented in stainless steel, and retains its richness through a lingering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Raptor Ridge 2018 Vineyard Select Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: The flavors mix tart citrus with bright tangerine and crisp apple. It's a far cry from the rosé-like 2016, and much more along the lines of most Oregon Pinot Gris. Fresh and tangy, it should be enjoyed over the next two or three years.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Duck Pond 2017 St. Jory Vineyard Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Light aromas of green and yellow apple and Oregon pear lead to a dry, flavorful palate etched with lively acidity that draws out the finish. There's a whole lot to like.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Milbrandt 2019 Pinot Grigio (Columbia Valley (WA))

Description: A delicate expression of this variety, this opens like a soft breeze, carrying on it lemon, orange, stone fruit and floral notes. The palate shows more personality, crunching with acidity amid bright, juicy fruit. Light bodied, this would be an easy, unoffensive white to have around the house for summertime sipping.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Punt Road 2019 Napoleone Vineyard Pinot Gris (Yarra Valley)

Description: Crisp notes of white grape and blossom perfume mouthwatering grapefruit and pear on the palate of this vibrant Pinot Gris. Dry and unoaked with a transparent fruit quality, it's a spry, thirst-quenching crowd-pleaser. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Villa Wolf 2018 Pinot Gris (Pfalz)

Appellation: Horse Heaven Hills, Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: Pear aromas are out front, followed by notes of apple and pineapple. Dry tropical and stone fruit flavors follow. It delivers broad appeal.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Canoe Ridge 2019 The Expedition Pinot Gris (Horse Heaven Hills)

Description: Demure whiffs of white grape and Asian pear introduce this very juicy, intensely fruity Pinot Gris. Full bodied and dry, it's a pleasantly grapy wine concentrated with plump yellow plum and grapefruit flavors. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Weingut Binz 2018 Nackenheimer Kabinett Trocken-Dry Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is a light, leesy and fresh style, keeping it simple and straightforward, all to good effect. A mix of citrus fruit flavors, notably grapefruit and lime, take center stage. It's crystal clear, clean and zesty, just a perfectly quaffable white wine.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Pike Road 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Subtle whiffs of fresh pear and peanut skins are amplified on the palate of this zesty dry white. Slim and unoaked, it's a refreshingly peppy wine accented by notes of tart green apple and lime. Drink now.                      Anna Lee C. Iijima
Name: Leonard Kreusch 2018 Rhein Pinot Gris (Rheinhessen)

Description: A green apple aroma follows over to the fresh palate along with green melon and a hint of white almond. Tangy acidity keeps it lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Confetti! 2019 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Appellation: Columbia Gorge (OR), Oregon Other, Oregon, US
Description: This is tart and racy, right up to the point of sour, with lemon and green-pineapple fruit. For the right foods (whitefish in a lemon sauce, for example, or even fresh oysters) this would be spot on. Don't look for the usual Willamette Valley style of Pinot Gris; this is from the Gorge, with less body, more acid and a mouthpuckering finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Hood Crest 2018 Pinot Gris (Columbia Gorge (OR))

Description: This copper-colored Pinot Grigio has delicate aromas of banana and yellow stone fruit. On the fresh palate, tangy acidity lifts yellow peach and a hint of red berry.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2018 Terradeiforti Colle Ara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Description: Honeysuckle and banana aromas lead the nose. The banana note carries over to the palate along with hints of pineapple and tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Albino Armani 2019 Corvara Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Description: An effusive rose aroma melds with red berry and a suggestion of fresh mint on the nose. The palate offers bruised apple, tart grapefruit, golden raspberry and wildflowers. There is a chalky feeling, and acidity weaves between tart and juicy, finishing with chalk and ruby grapefruit.                      Fiona Adams
Name: Cask Three Oh Seven 2018 Rosé of Pinot Grigio (Grand River Valley)

Description: Light bodied and diluted, this has subdued sensations recalling pear and citrus. It's bright, with crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Il Casato 2019 Pinot Grigio (Valdadige)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring blossom and ripe white stone fruit mingle with a whiff of cantaloupe on this delicious white. The aromas carry over to the round, full-bodied palate along with nutmeg and white almond. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kofererhof 2018 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Crisp and elegantly structured, this fragrant white has enticing scents of elderflower, white stone fruit and Alpine herb. On the savory palate, notes of ginger and a hint of cedar back up juicy yellow pear, white peach and lemon drop before finishing on a fennel note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Firmian 2018 Riserva Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Hawthorn, white stone-fruit and bread-dough aromas mingle with whiffs of Alpine herb and hazelnut on this elegant white. The polished palate delivers creamy white peach, ripe yellow pear, almond and citrus zest before finishing on a honeyed note. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mezzacorona 2016 Musivum Vicina Pinot Grigio (Trentino Superiore)

Description: From old vines at the estate, this offers unusually subtle spice and detail rather than just straightforward fleshy fruit. Asian pear and apple fruit are there in abundance, along with a lovely layer of caramel and light baking spices. The balance and length are exceptional.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Yamhill Valley 2018 Estate Pinot Gris (McMinnville)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apple, pear and citrus follow over to the savory palate along with green melon, ginger and tangerine zest. It's bright and delicious, with tangy acidity before a fresh, clean close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Acacia-flower, white stone-fruit and citrusy aromas waft out of the glass. On the full-bodied palate, hints of ginger accent yellow pear, white peach and lemon zest before a hint of white almond. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2018 Punggl Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This structured white opens with delicate scents of beeswax, white stone fruit and chamomile flower. On the round, medium-bodied palate, notes of honeyed almond accent yellow pear and creamy white peach.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Kurtatsch 2018 Penoner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, green apple and honeydew melon follow through to the juicy palate, along with a note of white peach. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2019 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This structured, delicious white shows Pinot Grigio's serious side, delivering juicy flavors of ripe yellow pear, apple, creamy peach and fennel. Tangy acidity and saline-like mineral notes and lemon thyme linger on the finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Nals Margreid 2018 Hill Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This small-production white is steely in apricot, apple and lemon flavors, with lasting freshness and verve. Expansive on the midpalate, it delivers light, nuanced flavors and is complex and balanced.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Thirty-Seven 2018 Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)

Description: Subtle aromas evoking honeydew melon, white stone fruit and Alpine wild flower shape the delicate nose. Round and medium bodied, the palate offers ripe yellow pear, white almond and tangy mineral before closing on a fennel note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2018 Vigna Castel Ringberg Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Vivid and rich notions of ripe juicy yellow pear and baked pear tell the tale of the hot 2018 summer. The dry palate corrals this ripeness with its textural pithy richness, lending it balance in its boldness. This is rounded, full-bodied, dry and very fruity.                      Anne Krebiehl MW
Name: Kracher 2018 Pinot Gris (Burgenland)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Though labeled Willamette Valley, this is 100% estate-grown fruit from the Dundee Hills. It's tart and bracing, with lemon-lime fruit vividly defined by the acidity. Those flavors continue with green apple in the mix as well, and then open up with a touch of almond candy through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: Sokol Blosser 2018 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: Aged for seven months in large oak casks, this full-bodied white has aromas suggesting white stone fruit, coconut and a whiff of coffee bean. The aromas follow through to the rounded palate, along with fruity sensations of apricot and yellow apple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tiefenbrunner 2018 Turmhof Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Crisp, clean and linear, this snappy, savory white features white-spring-flower, ripe pear and lemon-zest sensations. Bright acidity and tangy saline notes give it a racy edge and a pristine finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this bright wine opens with aromas of white stone fruit, spring blossom and beeswax. On the tangy, linear palate, vibrant acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of tangy saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Infiné 1939 2018 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Fermented and aged partly in large casks and partly in barrique, this full-bodied white has aromas and flavors of oak, coconut and cedar. It closes on a bitter-almond note.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Abbazia di Novacella 2018 Praepositus Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: Aromas of hazelnut, beeswax and honey follow on the medium-bodied palate along with apple, citrus and a hint of mineral. Crisp acidity keeps if fresh and lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alois Lageder 2018 Porer Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Green apple, elderflower and citrus aromas form the nose. The fruity sensations carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with creamy yellow pear and orange zest before a bright, tangy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Erste Neue 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Alto Adige Valle Isarco, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Showing the serious side of Pinot Grigio, this offers alluring aromas of elderflower, white stone fruit and crushed Alpine herb. The crisp savory palate delivers ripe pear and Meyer lemon alongside lively acidity and a hint of saline.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Pacher Hof 2018 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

Description: This offers heady scents of spring blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of crushed mint. Reflecting the nose, the crisp palate offers Anjou pear, honeydew melon and a hint of Alpine herb.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kupelwieser 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear and green apple carry over to the palate, along with hints of saline and bitter almond. Tangy acidity gives it a juicy finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Peter Zemmer 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This offers delicate scents of white wild flower and honeydew melon while the tangy palate shows pear, lemon drop and a hint of cantaloupe. Fresh acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Cantina Tramin 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Green-apple and citrus aromas follow through to the bright palate along with notes of Alpine herb and green melon. It's fresh, with tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Colterenzio 2018 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring blossom and white stone-fruit aromas mingle together on this fresh, savory white. The light-bodied, rounded palate delivers white peach, juicy pear and a hint of Alpine fennel alongside tangy acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Franz Haas 2018 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This has delicate aromas suggesting spring blossom and white stone fruit. On the light-bodied palate, fresh acidity accompanies yellow pear and ripe apple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Elena Walch 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of almond and red apple carry the nose of this Pinot Grigio that spent up to 12 hours on its skins after crush. Citrus and apple peel flavors are honed by slight melon-rind and almond tones on the palate, with lifted acidity lending support to the creamy frame.                      Alexander Peartree
Name: Novaripa 2018 Monatic Amber Pinot Grigio (Terre di Chieti)

Description: The aromas are pleasing, with notes of pear, crushed flower and apple. Dry, even flavors follow. A lovely sense of acidity ties it together.                      Sean P. Sullivan
Name: Beauty in Chaos 2018 Pinot Grigio (Washington)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: White stone-fruit and spring-blossom aromas waft out of the glass. On the bright palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe yellow pear and mature apple.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bollini 2019 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Very fruity and nicely polished, this medium-bodied, unoaked wine offers fresh peach and apple flavors and a rounded texture. A light buttery, earthy aroma starts it off before the fresh fruit moves in.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Kendall-Jackson 2018 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Gris (California)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented and aged, this lively white wine has wide appeal in its sweet floral nose and layers of vanilla and peach. Expressive, textured and bright, it is well made.                      Virginie Boone
Name: Ferrari-Carano 2019 Pinot Grigio (Russian River Valley)

Description: The nose on this wine is lovely and open: Orange, lime and lavender potpourri scents are all delicate and pretty. It's not quite as harmonious on the palate. The acidity is lifted and prickly but feels a bit forced, and there's a slight bitterness at the finish. But the attractive fruit and floral notes are there on the midpalate particularly.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Innocent Bystander 2018 Pinot Gris (Victoria)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This is solidly varietal, with strong fruit components of melon and pear. Full bodied and fruit-forward, it's styled for drinking while young, perhaps chilled a bit, and served outdoors with a summer picnic.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: La Chouette 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: The wine has a shy nose that eventually suggests crushed stone and Bartlett pear. On the linear palate, tangy acidity accompanies ripe yellow apple, lemon thyme and a hint of dried chamomile.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: St. Pauls 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Aged in large cask and tonneaux, this has aromas of beeswax, cedar and toasted nut. On the round, full-bodied palate, bright acidity lifts butterscotch, pear and honeyed notes before a coffee-bean close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tramin 2018 Unterebner Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: One of the best value whites coming out of Italy, this enjoyable wine has aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. Crisp and savory, the fresh palate offers yellow pear and juicy citrus before a hint of white almond signals the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Mezzacorona 2019 Estate Bottled Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: Aromas of green apple and pear march over to the tangy palate along, with a hint of Meyer lemon. Crisp acidity lifts the fruity flavors.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Bottega Vinaia 2019 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This full-bodied wine is vibrant and structured, showing a spicy, earthy influence in addition to clean and crisp apple and Bosc pear flavors. The texture has a little bite that's appetizing. No added sulfites.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Frey 2018 Organic Pinot Grigio (Mendocino)

Description: Crisp and medium-bodied, this refreshing white has pretty aromas of white spring flower and pear. The tangy palate offers ripe apple, white peach and a citrusy note alongside vibrant acidity before an almond close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted nut, oak and coconut lead the nose along with a whiff of white stone fruit. The racy palate is on the lean side, evoking yellow apple, bitter almond and hints of butterscotch alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Maso Cantaghel 2018 Maso Papa Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
Description: This is a fruity Pinot Grigio that leads with lime, pineapple rind, lychee and honeysuckle. It's a little on the candied side, but plenty will find it appealing. Acidity on the palate is crisp and bright, buoying a creamy, fruity mouthfeel. A bitter melon-rind note shows on the finish.                      Christina Pickard
Name: Yellow Tail 2019 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)

Description: Anjou pear aromas follow over to the straightforward tangy palate, along with notes of green apple and citrus. Bright acidity keeps it fresh.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Girlan 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: This has a subdued nose that eventually reveals whiffs of pressed chamomile flower toasted hazelnut. The palate is shy in terms of fruit richness, suggesting bitter almond and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kellerei Kaltern Caldaro 2018 Soll Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: French oak, butterscotch and coconut aromas dominate the nose. The flavors follow through to the firm, full-bodied along with cedar, vanilla and coffee bean but it lacks fruit richness.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Peter Zemmer 2017 Giati Riserva Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This has fruity aromas of honeydew melon and green apple. The aromas follow through to the light, easygoing palate along with a hint of peach and crisp acidity.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Alta Luna 2019 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate scents of spring blossom and red berry, and (thanks to brief maceration of the grape skins in the must) a pretty copper color. On the palate, tangy acidity accompanies peach and pomegranate before a saline close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Casata Monfort 2019 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: The rather shy nose evokes spring wildflower and white stone fruit. On the crisp palate, vibrant acidity accompanies suggestions of green apple and pear before a citrusy close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Kris 2019 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Description: Crisp and clean, this opens with delicate aromas of spring blossom and white stone fruit. On the vibrant palate, fresh acidity accompanies green apple and a hint of white peach.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Tolloy 2019 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)

Description: Fruity aromas of apple and pear follow over to the light-bodied palate, along with a hint of green melon. Tangy acidity gives it a bright finish.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Zenato 2019 Pinot Grigio (Delle Venezie)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This has delicate scents suggesting spring blossom and white stone fruit. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity accompanies white peach and green apple while the barest hint of almond marks the close.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castelfeder 2019 Mont Mès Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: White stone-fruit and yellow wild-flower aromas form the delicate nose. On the refreshing palate, tangy acidity accompanies honeydew melon and ripe Bartlett pear.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: Castel Firmian 2019 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Description: This wine is clean and refreshing, boasting modest but tasty peach and apple flavors on a fairly crisp texture. It's just what many people are looking for in this variety.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Line 39 2018 Pinot Grigio (California)

Appellation: Willamette Valley, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: This wine is soft in the mouth, full bodied with ripe pear fruit, and a cottony impression. Though simple and fruity, it lingers nicely through the finish.                      Paul Gregutt
Name: High Pass 2019 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)

Description: A yellow-leaning tint and aromas of spiced apple open this Pinot Grigio that's citrusy and malic in feel. Citrus and apple flavors are more basic than complex, while the finish offers grip and pop.                      Michael Schachner
Name: Santa Julia 2019 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza)

Description: Aromas of green apple follow over to the fresh palate along with green melon and a hint of white almond. Tangy acidity keeps it lively.                      Kerin O’Keefe
Name: La Vis 2019 Pinot Grigio (Trentino)

Appellation: South Eastern Australia, Australia Other, Australia
